Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark licorice, dust and sage meet a thread of white pepper in this deliciously built, powerful and complex wine from an old-vine estate site. Juicy blackberry dominates on the midpalate in concentrated form, seasoned in graceful hints of nutmeg and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2019 Highwire Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Seductively smooth and weathered in crisp cranberry, plum and dark cherry, this old-vine wine offers a substantial grip of tannin and notes of crushed rock and oak. Velvety texture leads to dusty black pepper, nutmeg and tobacco.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2019 Jolene's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With the addition of 20% mixed black grapes from 100-plus year-old vines, this consistently interesting, complex wine opens in thick tones of leather, tobacco and cedar. Savory throughout, it tastes of crushed rock, wild blackberry and a tease of gamy meat. It was aged entirely in French oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Armida 2018 Tina's Block Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart and acid-driven, this wine is surprisingly bright and red fruited, with citrus undertones. Soft, integrated tannins provide structure around an elegant midpalate of graceful oak, a mix of both French and American, leading the way to a spicy, peppery and herbal finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Armida 2018 Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This well-constructed bottling, which includes 15% Petite Sirah, kicks off with blackberry-jam aromas that are cut by dried meat, violet, iodine and tar. Those hearty, rugged qualities spread into the sip, where jammy flavors meet with licorice and cola spice. Persistent acidity and supportive tannins ensure even better days to come. Drink now through 2028.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Caliza 2018 Primitivo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Succulent, with structure and tension in its bones, this hearty, full-bodied wine expresses thick waves of juicy blackberry, dark cherry and cola, the oak well-integrated within a spicy component of nutmeg and white pepper. Planted more than a century ago, the head-trained vines yield low amounts of delicious, concentrated grapes.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2019 Hartford Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy plum, black cherry and a hint of cola highlight a soft, round core in this wine. Structured and well integrated in both tannin and oak, it offers a length of baking spice and tobacco, impressing in style and powerful elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benovia 2018 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dense black fruit contrasts against a tartness of cranberry, the acidity sharp and beautifully complementary to the dry-farmed, head-trained structure of the wine. Powerful grip speaks to its youthful vigor, unwinding slowly in the glass.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2019 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Not much of this was made, sadly, as it delivers velvety thick, rich and tension-filled grip around firm, structured tannin. Blue and black fruit dominate in concentrated form, dusted in nutmeg and oak, from vines more than 100 years old.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2019 Winberrie Knolls Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A dry-farmed site planted 100 years ago and head-trained still, Dina's is a study in baked cherry, blackberry and plum, rich and viscously thick. Velvety tannins and ample weight provide an unctuous lushness that is complemented by underlying acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2019 Dina's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: By all measures, this is a big Zin, but it remains very dry and regal as well. Ripe aromas of blackberry, black plum and baking spice are suave and joyous on the nose. The palate tightens up around firm tannins that frame those lush black-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2018 Paper Street Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoothly integrated, complex and structured, this impressive wine is dry, leathery and gamy. Brooding blackberry and black-cherry flavors get a boost of complexity in the form of peppery spice: a mix of white pepper, nutmeg and clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Jewell 2018 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: By all measures, this is a big Zin, but it remains very dry and regal as well. Ripe aromas of blackberry, black plum and baking spice are suave and joyous on the nose. The palate tightens up around firm tannins that frame those lush black-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2018 Paper Street Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Deep and brooding, this quietly powerful wine is drenched in black-fruit flavors and accented by hints of clove, vanilla and cinnamon for a great sense of complexity along with rich and satisfying fruitiness. Full bodied yet rather soft in tannins, it has a supple mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2018 Pilgrim Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an undeniably powerful, concentrated and intensely flavorful wine accented by leather and oak tones. Black fruit, coffee, licorice and baked fig provide a succulent core of richness and offer impressive length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2018 Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a dry-farmed vineyard named for its founder, this is a thick, spicy red wine, dazzling in black pepper, leather and tobacco. Lively, layered and complex, it intrigues in its grasp of high-toned acidity and length of enduring freshness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Square Peg 2017 Square Peg Estate Ottimino's Block Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An enticing layer of rich oak spices enhances the deep, dark-fruit flavors of this full-bodied wine. Clove, cinnamon, cedar and vanilla meld with plump blackberry notes that are nicely lifted by moderate tannins. It was aged in 40% new French oak barrels.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2018 Amador Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a spicy spin on this historic vineyard, starting with aromas of star anise, cinnamon, plum pudding, wild mint and strawberry cream. It's thick on the palate, carrying wild, snappy berry and currant flavors along with fennel, dewy pine and cocoa.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2018 Dante Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in a refined style that will appeal to Pinot Noir drinkers, this red is spicy and brambly in blackberry and cherry with a hint of black licorice. The persistent acidity keeps it fresh and lengthy as well as balanced, with nuanced oak staying largely out of the way.                      Virginie Boone
Name: AldenAlli 2017 Limerick Lane Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this is a fresh and zesty style of Zinfandel, showing strawberry, fennel and light garden herbs on the nose. The lovely palate is also fresh with tart red-plum and raspberry flavors, filled in by baking spices and dried herbs. The higher alcohol is not apparent at all.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Allan Hancock 2019 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This reserve bottling, which is a one-third-each blend from Dante Dusi, Jardine and Paper Street vineyards, is bold on all fronts. Jammy aromas of blackberry and black cherry meet with loads of clove and fudge on the nose. The palate is thick in texture, offering undulating waves of rich and ripe black-currant jam, Christmas-spice and orange-peel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2018 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and dark in brooding black fruit and ample oak, this grippy, youthful wine is spicy in root beer and black pepper. Fig and a touch of earthy underbrush add to the complex mix.                      Virginie Boone
Name: David Clinton 2017 Teldeschi Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Thickly concentrated in mountain fruit, this is made from a good portion of 100-year-old vines. Black peppercorn, tannin, dried herb and mineral combine to make a forceful punch of earthy blackberry, plum and nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Clif Family 2017 Gary's Improv Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas of desert scrub brush, dark cherry, anise and clove show on the nose of this bottling. Those dry earth herbs pick up a tobacco tone on the palate, which also offers fennel-frond, red-cherry and menthol flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pianetta 2018 Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Madera, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This light-colored, well-balanced, almost delicate wine goes against the norms of Zinfandel, offering light raspberry and red-cherry flavors, a nice tang of acidity and subtle tannins. It's easy to enjoy its elegance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Toca Madera 2017 Estate Bottled Unfined & Unfiltered Zinfandel (Madera)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Black licorice, candied blackberry and toasted oak highlight the concentrated intensity of this rich and vicious wine from the historic estate. Smoked meat and coffee characteristics round out the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: David Clinton 2017 Mounts Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine shows a very fresh, potent, smoky-spicy profile that's nicely backed by ripe fruit. Elements of charred herbs and black pepper accompany plump strawberry and plum notes that capture the attention. Winemaker Pietro Buttitta blended in 7% Aglianico and 7% Petite Sirah grapes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia NV Zinfandel

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This fresh-tasting, fruity wine is jam-packed with strawberries, blackberries and hints of vanilla on a broad, smooth texture. It is generous, not too full bodied and simply easy to appreciate for its exuberance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gen5 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Classic aromas of wild berries and chaparral meet very ripe, indulgent fruit flavors in this full-bodied but supple and polished wine. This stand-out from one of Amador's top-quality producers was fermented with native yeast and aged in neutral oak barrels.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2018 The Native Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine is dry-farmed and organically grown. The results are undeniably good—a mix of juicy blackberry and cherry that is exuberantly fresh and soft in tannin and well-integrated oak. Complex, it slowly unwinds to show baking-spice and lavender elements that intrigue.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Quivira 2018 Pillsbury Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Wonderful complexity is this full-bodied wine's strong point, from aromas of wild berries, sage, dried meat and tobacco to mouthfilling flavors of raspberry, strawberry and mint. Full body and light tannins form a structure that nicely supports the cornucopia of flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2018 Estate Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This flavorful, full-bodied wine wraps bold blackberry and blueberry flavors in rich tannins for a creamy, mouthfilling texture. Hints of black pepper and woodsmoke add layers of complexity that play back and forth on the palate and create a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2017 Two Bud Block Reserve Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Full bodied and snuggly wrapped in velvety tannins, this wine sports black-pepper aromas and vivid cranberry and blackberry flavors that will need an extra-rich dish for a good pairing, or some time in the cellar to soften the tannins. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peter Franus 2018 Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This quietly complex wine goes deep into subtle blackberry, fig and coffee flavors, while rich, fine-grained tannins add just enough structure for good balance. Nicely integrated hints of vanilla, cinnamon and mocha come out with more sipping, and the finish lingers.                      Jim Gordon
Name: M2 2018 Soucie Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Wonderful fruit complexity, a full body and a velvety texture add up to a lot of enjoyment in this concentrated, layered release. Blackberry, dried plum, blueberry and a hint of espresso make an enticing combination while moderate tannins support them well.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2018 Giannecchini Family Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and broad in pomegranate, blood orange and blackberry, this wine also offers tremendously appealing and complex seasonings of dried herb and black pepper. Balanced by underlying acidity, it shows the intensity and intellectual satisfaction of old vines.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Intricate, complex fruit flavors and a good, firm texture make this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine delicious and well-suited for food pairings. Aromas of raspberries and cranberries meet deeper blackberry flavors shaded by black pepper and mint.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Testa Vineyards 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very concentrated flavors and hefty tannins give this full-bodied wine a robust profile to match the most savory braise or risotto. Deep blackberry, black fig and late-picked plum coat the palate with richness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mathew Gibson 2015 Estate Primitivo (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This bold red is in fact a field blend with 12% mixed blacks within: a combo of Alicante Bouschet, Carignan and Petite Sirah. Savory in pepper, leather and oak, it is both complex and concentrated with enduring structure. The vineyard dates back to 1879.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beltane Ranch 2018 Estate Grown Heins Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This brawny but well-behaved wine offers superripe flavors of blackberry jam and black raisins drenched in fine-grained tannins on an extremely full body. Great concentration and saturation give it a rich palate and lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2017 Family Reserve Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked blackberry aromas provide intense density on the nose of this bottling, with accents of fennel frond and cola adding nuance. The palate combines baked earth and sagebrush flavors with black currant and blackberry, with just enough tension holding it together.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ancient Peaks 2018 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Pure, jammy, palate-pleasing flavors of raspberries, black cherries and strawberries light up this full-bodied wine. A nip of tannin helps firm the texture as the fruitiness floods the mouth and extends into the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2018 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This well-balanced, flavorful and firmly textured wine will be a great mealtime pour, bringing grippy tannins and deep blackberry and plum flavors to the table. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Winery SF 2016 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a delicate frame and understated ripeness, this red is framed in black licorice and black cherry, with a lightness of baking spice and black pepper. The oak is quietly interwoven to provide weight and structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paradise Ridge 2018 Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This impressive, firmly structured wine holds luscious black-pepper, blackberry, rhubarb and toasted oak flavors firmly with significant tannins and a full body. Best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Handley 2016 Kazmet Vineyard Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick, muscular and concentrated, this soft, richly layered red is a study in jammy cherry and berry, lavender and black pepper. The oak is prominent and supportive, adding notes of vanilla and toast.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kokomo 2018 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Baked red-cherry and strawberry aromas meet with Christmas spices of nutmeg and cardamom on the nose of this bottling. The sip lands with ripe and roasted fruit flavors, but they are quickly cut by savory tobacco leaf, baking spice and decent acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2018 Tank 15 Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Ripe and jammy aromas lead to expressive, fresh blackberry and raspberry flavors in this full-bodied but not very tannic wine. It tastes generous, mouthfilling and fruity without getting heavy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sottomarino 2016 Primitivo (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Ripe and jammy aromas lead to expressive, fresh blackberry and raspberry flavors in this full-bodied but not very tannic wine. It tastes generous, mouthfilling and fruity without getting heavy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sottomarino 2016 Primitivo (Lake County)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pomegranate, red plum, anise and cardamom aromas lead to full-bodied, rich, almost creamy feeling flavors. It doesn't have the tart snap that often ties this variety together, but there's plenty to enjoy.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2018 Red Heaven Vineyard Zinfandel (Red Mountain)

Appellation: San Antonio Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lighter in the glass than many Zins, this bottling takes an earthy approach to the grape, with aromas of gravel, baked brick and tart red fruits most apparent. The palate is very mellow in light red-currant and pepper flavors, relying more on the tense texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Absolution 2018 Johnson Family Vineyard Zinfandel (San Antonio Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of fresh black fruit and toasted oak meet dashes of black pepper, vanilla and woodsmoke in this sturdy, full-bodied but lightly tannic wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2017 Clockspring Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plummy and tasting of Port-like dried fruit, this big, jammy wine is intensely ripe and concentrated, with a softness to the tannin structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jigar 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of caramel, butterscotch and light pepper show a ton of oak influence on the nose of this bottling. It lands softly on the palate with lush, caramel-soaked flavors of baked strawberry. It's perfect for oak lovers.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opolo 2019 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Very fruity, jammy flavors give this medium-bodied wine a sense of sweetness as its ample raspberry and blackberry flavors are carried on a soft, smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lapis Luna 2019 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Black-cherry paste, roasted fig, fruitcake, nutmeg and licorice aromas make for a very spicy and ripe nose on this bottling. The palate shows more of a prune flavor, elevated by root-beer spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2016 Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a good, full-bodied wine that combines fresh berry flavors with sweet-seeming maple and toasted oak flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Specialyst 2018 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An unusual, smoky, flinty initial aroma is followed by black-olive, black-pepper and wood-char flavors in this full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2018 Estate Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This delicate wine is a breath of fresh air for the variety—an expressive, lengthy and vibrant take that tastes great. Baking spice, orange and cranberry flavors highlight the graceful palate, balanced by bright acidity and a flourish of lavender on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gary Farrell 2017 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite deep and concentrated, this luxuriously ripe wine overflows with blackberry jam and black pepper flavors on a full body laced with moderate tannins. Hints of wood char and cedar add a spicy, oaky touch that's well integrated.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2018 Duarte Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Warm oak spices of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove put a wonderful spin on the rich, ripe, blackberry and blueberry flavors in this full-bodied wine. It is rounded in feel and concentrated in fruit character.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This hearty, almost meaty, wine offers bold blackberry and light wood smoke flavors on a firm texture of tannins and good acidity. It has chewy, grippy mouth-feel and the concentrated fruit flavors to match that structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2018 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from the oldest vines in the Pacific Northwest, planted in the late 1800s. Appealing aromas of raspberry, cranberry and baking spice are followed by a broad but sophisticated palate. It's a tribute to the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: History 2017 The Pines Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Packed with vibrant red cherry and raspberry flavors, this technically full-bodied wine feels fresh and lively in texture and has mild tannins that give a bit of grip. Its appetizing balance was probably enhanced by the Anderson Valley's cool climate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Fashauer Vineyard Zinfandel (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Enticing spices and luscious, ripe fruit flavors make a great combination in this lush-textured, full-bodied wine. Aromatic notes of vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg complement palate impressions of warm, sun-ripened blackberries and raspberries.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Peacock Patch Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hints of black pepper and woodsmoke on the nose lead to ripe plum and peppered-meat flavors that are rich enough to sink your teeth into. This full-bodied, lightly tannic wine offers complexity and power.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Packed with vibrant red cherry and raspberry flavors, this technically full-bodied wine feels fresh and lively in texture and has mild tannins that give a bit of grip. Its appetizing balance was probably enhanced by the Anderson Valley's cool climate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Fashauer Vineyard Zinfandel (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and plushly textured wine starts with wild berry and underbrush aromas followed by ripe blackberry and black-plum flavors. Its concentration and smoothness combine for great sipping.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ryan Beauregard is showing smart restraint in his effort to tame and direct this mountain-grown Zinfandel. Aromas of berry jam, redwood and charcuterie are complex and savory on the nose. The lightly bodied palate offers crunchy cranberry, light pomegranate, hints of baked earth and crumpled herbs. There's a toasty tone to the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Beauregard 2018 Beauregard Ranch Zinfandel (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smoky, spicy wine wraps potent blackberry flavors in black pepper, beef and wood smoke for a dark and delicious effect. It is full-bodied, moderately tannic and nicely concentrated.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sidebar 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe and accessible aromas of red currant, strawberry, loamy soil and sweet flowers show on the nose of this bottling from a region that once grew the most grapes in California. Cedar and sandalwood flavors frame the jammy, sappy palate, where blackberry and black plum flavors meet with an herbal hint of pine needle and finish on a caramel tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cavaletti 2019 4th and Haven Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry, cherry, soy and hints of damp oak show on the lush nose of this bottling. Soft tannins make for a voluptuous palate, where roasted black cherry and smoky oak leads to a familiar caramel-laced finished.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opaque 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a ripe, traditional Zinfandel in all its jammy glory. Aromas of strawberry sorbet and blackberry syrup lead into a fresh, juicy palate of grape Jolly Rancher and baking spice, proving playful and joyous to sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boekenoogen 2018 Bell Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (Monterey)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This hearty wine shapes blackberry and black-pepper flavors with moderate tannins and a full body that are attractively mouthfilling. Hints of vanilla, clove and cedar add extra interest and a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2017 Catfish Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Pure, delicious fruit aromas and flavors practically light up this well-balanced, easy-drinking wine. It shows light tannins and a smooth texture that's nicely tangy, too. A lingering fresh berry character marks the close.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paul Dolan 2019 Made with Organic Grapes Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: When Zinfandel grapes are left to ripen and shrivel to the point of overt sweetness, they can make a potently flavorful wine like this that is lightly sweet and very full bodied. It will be a good after-dinner drink or a good choice for pairing with dried, aged cheese.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Rocky Point Vineyard Late Harvest Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Mint and pine flavors mingle with robust blackberries and raspberries in this full-bodied, lightly tannic wine as it spreads generously across the palate. Very good balance combined with tasty concentration make it extra enjoyable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2019 Estate Grown Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pruney, old-vine red fruit dominates in this bold, brawny wine, which is dense and substantial on the palate. From a site planted in 1885 it shows Old World ruggedness and a hint of potpourri amidst the leathery texture and lasting baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whipsmart Wine Company 2018 Mossy Block Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied, slightly extracted aromas of black plum and blackberry are a touch tangy on the nose of this bottling. The palate is snappy with fresh boysenberry and light licorice flavors, as tart acidity carries into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Deep blackberry and black-olive flavors are tinged with mint and licorice in this full-bodied, rich-textured wine. It's generous and mouthfilling, showing elevated alcohol and not too much tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Appellations Cellars 2017 Survivor Old Vine Westwind Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tasting of chocolate-covered espresso bean and dark cherry and currant, this wine is thick and supple, with substantial ripeness. Jammy flavors meet a foundation of toasted oak and baking spice, finishing earthy and rustic.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Portalupi 2018 Dolinsek Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Herbal and peppery, this wine includes 10% Petite Sirah. Thick and jammy layers of blackberry provide richness along a supple palate of weight and breadth, finishing in vanilla-laced oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pedroncelli 2018 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Concentrated in flavor and firmly tannic in texture, this full-bodied wine offers smoky, tarry aromas, potent blackberry flavors and accents of grilled herbs. No sulfites added.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2019 Organic Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Extracted and smoky aromas of hickory, baked black plum, caramel and fudge converge on the oaky nose of this bottling. The palate is coated in oak as well, but touches of baked plum, nutmeg, clove and caramel also show.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Oak Mountain 2016 Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This exuberant and fruity wine overflows with raspberry and strawberry flavors and offers subtle salty, toasty accents. Although full bodied, it's fairly soft in texture and leaves a sugary impression on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2019 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With accents of leather, this red is thick in dense black fruit, iron and a note of reduction. Made from certified-organic grapes, it contains small amounts of Mourvèdre and Petite Sirah.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Preston 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is an intensely built, ripe and robust red wine, aged in both European and American oak. Smoked meats, coffee grounds and woody cedar combine around a supple, richly layered midpalate that finishes smooth and simple.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Acre 2018 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Superripe and somewhat sweet flavors of dried fruit give this wine a Port-like expression. It is quite full bodied and packed with raisin and prune notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2018 Special Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Vegan and reductive, this wine is gargantuan in size and ripeness, with earthy iron and garrigue notes accenting a core of jammy, over-the-top blackberry flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Messenger 2018 28 Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine wraps smoky, dark-berry flavors in firm tannins that give it a drying mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2019 Biodynamic Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Tasting mature and mellow, the jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine are giving way to tired balsamic notes. It's smooth, not very tannic and ready to drink.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Appellations Cellars 2017 Ancestor Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Drenched with ultrarich fruit flavors, this generous, full-bodied and mouthfilling wine is an unabashed, fully ripened wine that exults in Zinfandel's jammy blackberry and blueberry extravagance. High octane but also supple in texture, this will be a great wine to linger over at the end of a special meal. Best through 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2018 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From vines planted originally in 1927, this vineyard-designate is tart and high-toned, with layers of pomegranate, currant and cherry. Smooth on the palate and fully integrated, it has length and breadth, holding its weight and power with effortless grace.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2018 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A Zinfandel-led field blend from a site planted originally in 1854, this explodes on the palate in graceful, well-integrated layers of blueberry and strawberry, evoking wild versions of both. Bright, complex and structured, it dabbles in baking spice and leathery black pepper, ending in a feral quality of garrigue.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2018 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an outstanding representation of the site: leathery, spicy and earthy, with a length of dried herb, cherry and cassis. Exuberantly layered yet lifted, it is structured, complex and memorable. Enjoy from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This historic vineyard contributes a wealth of complexity and structure to this wine, which is a juicy, robust expression of the mountain site. Red fruit is complemented by red licorice, with savory components of dried herb and crushed rock chiming in.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the producer's estate this possesses 85% Zinfandel, 12% Syrah and 3% Petite Sirah. Together they contrast and complement in iron, graphite and earth, with lengthy and supple texture. The concentration of fruit is richly complex in blueberry and boysenberry, balanced in acidity and a dusty mineral quality that extends on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2018 Rocky Knoll Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an impressive wine from a historic old-vine site. Brawny leather and red cherry are vibrant and full on the palate, with tremendous underlying structure. Nutmeg, lavender and white pepper accents contribute to the wine's widespread appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Williams Selyem 2018 Saitone Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From vines planted in 1880, this red develops slowly in the glass, unfurling waves of old-vine savory character and reductive youth. Dust, crushed rock and quenching acidity complement and combine to highlight juicy red fruit, dried herb and a complex note of spicy cola. It is powerful in weight and substance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2018 Banfield Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Complexity and balance are the hallmarks of this beautifully composed and full-bodied 100% Zinfandel wine. Black-pepper, dried sage, and deep blackberry aromas lead to a rich, velvety, subtly tannic texture and supple black-fruit impressions. Best through 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2018 East Bench Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Blackberry, cherry and lavender notes highlight this effusively aromatic and delicious red, which features a velvety lushness and supple tannin. Complex and spicy, the acidity is remarkably well integrated, adding to the overall freshness and lift of the wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Aldo's Vineyard Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This luscious, opulent, high-octane wine oozes dried-fruit flavors that are supersaturated and deep, offering raspberry- syrup and blackberry-jam notes on a full body with well-integrated tannins. It feels sweet and so inviting.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2018 Big Wood Zin Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A wonderful, spicy, woodsy complexity in the aroma leads to luxuriously rich blackberry and raspberry flavors and echoes of cedar, vanilla and sage. With 24% Syrah blended in, this beautifully composed and relaxed wine is hard to resist.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2018 Mountain Selection Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 2% Petite Sirah, this estate red impresses in supple, succulent red berries and a twist of licorice, offering a length of powerful flavor and grippy texture. Crushed rock and herb provide a current of minerality that plays well against the sweet oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2018 1910 Block Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine offers vibrant fruit and handsome oak spices on a big structure of firm tannins and a full body. Hints of mint and cedar lead to plump blackberry and raspberry shaded by accents of vanilla and nutmeg. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2014 Centennial Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This bold and firmly structured wine carries vivid raspberry and black-cherry aromas followed by a moderately tannic palate of cranberry and raspberry flavors. It's well balanced and can easily improve with a few years of age. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2018 Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With Petite Sirah and Syrah, this red impresses and overdelivers on its price point, packing in tons of textured, supple flavor and juicy acidity. Full bodied, it brims in brambly blackberry, cherry and plum, with a lasting sweetness of vanilla and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Marietta Cellars 2018 Angeli Estate Grown Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This well-balanced, medium-bodied wine has everything in good proportion, from salty, mineral aromas to raspberry and tart cherry on the palate, to mouthfilling cherry and plum flavors, to a lithe structure of moderate tannin and acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2018 Blasi Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This robust, full-bodied wine made from the Italian strain of Zinfandel grapevines fills its moderately tannic frame with delicious, dark-cherry, blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors. A touch of tangy raspberry lifts the palate and extends the finish for a lasting impression.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Supple, velvety and lush, this gorgeously generous wine offers elements of baked cherry and strawberry alongside exuberant acidity. Clove, licorice and tobacco notes lend depth and complexity to the whole.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Williams Selyem 2018 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a richly layered and complex wine from the great estate site. It is juicy and expressive in bold flavors of cherry and blackberry. With a softness to the palate, it invites one into a supple tannin structure and integrated oak, finishing in just a subtle hint of vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mike and Molly Hendry 2018 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The historic site first planted in the 1920s contributes a great deal of complexity and nuance to this wine, which opens in classic old-vine prune and fig. Sleek, sublime texture rides along the palate with ease and grace, defying its ultimate powerful concentration and oaky ripeness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From vines planted in 1912, this wine opens in high-toned citrus and tangy red fruit dipped in root beer. Grippy texture reveals its youthful power and structure, adding to an already enviable length of baking spice and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2018 Katz-Ponzo Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hints of herbs, wood smoke and sour cherries give this full-bodied and well-balanced wine an attractive complexity from the first sniff through the lingering finish. It details singed rosemary, charcoal, blackberry and cacao.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2017 Hooker Creek Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This bold and expressive wine starts with mild mint and other oak-spice aromas and then brings a blast of superfresh and vibrant fruit flavors to the palate. Just-crushed grapes, blueberries and raspberries flood the flavors and linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Marietta Cellars 2018 Román Estate Grown Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Beautiful fruit and baking-spice aromas lead to satisfying flavors of raspberry, strawberry and sweet cherry in this very well-balanced, complex and inviting wine. Moderate tannins and a bit of tangy acidity lift the texture and give an appetizing bite.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2018 InZinerator Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Deep and concentrated, this blueberry- and blackberry-scented wine is absolutely mouthfilling and delicious. Its ripeness and full body absorb any tannins, and leave a smooth, opulent texture, with baking spices lingering on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2018 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is strongly shaped by firm tannins and a spicy, new-oak quality that fills the aroma with cedar, mint and nutmeg that last through the flavors and finish. It is firm in texture, holding in generous, tasty blackberry and strawberry tones.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McNab Ridge 2018 Family Reserve Cononiah Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This forthright wine showcases the classic Zin characteristics of wild berries and black pepper on a firm texture of fruit acidity and moderate tannins. It is well balanced and ready for most any occasion.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Skinner 2018 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This powerful wine is herbal and smoky in aroma, then packed with black-pepper and woodsmoke flavors that give it unusually sharp focus to go along with its appetizing structure of firm tannins and full body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 ReZerve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Robust and ripe, this red is richly hedonistic in blackberry and cola flavors. Earthy undercurrents of crushed rock and dried herb contrast and complement the fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Eleven Eleven 2018 Moss Creek Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big and juicy, round and smooth, this full-bodied wine from a historic vineyard offers ultraripe plum, prune and dried cherry flavors on a soft, non-tannic texture. It is well concentrated and so ripe that it comes off as slightly sweet.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2018 Vineyard 1869 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well-concentrated blackberry and black-pepper flavors invigorate this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine, giving it plenty to savor.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bold in flavor and big in body, this wine is packed with ripe fruit and cedar, balsam and beef flavors that are well concentrated and nicely supported by moderate tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2018 Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This rich, ripe and showy wine offers a deep color, lavish spice aromas and mouthfilling chocolate and blackberry-jam flavors. Dramatic cinnamon, vanilla and ginger notes linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Klinker Brick 2017 Old Ghost Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grilled meat and smoky oak dominate on the opening of this estate wine, leading to a soft, juicy and approachable palate of root beer and raspberry jam. With herbal underpinnings, it presents as a big, broad-shouldered wine, with lasting oak and nutmeg spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bartholomew Estate 2018 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a bright entry of red fruit, this field blend is rounded and richly full bodied, balanced by its underlying acidity and waves of dried herb and clove. Leather, black pepper and a touch of nutmeg figure into the hearty mix.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2019 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A minty, menthol character enhances this full-bodied, fully ripe wine as it coats the palate with plump blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors. It's rich in expression and broad in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2018 Pick and Shovel Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Very ripe, late-picked fruit flavors are well matched by generous oak accents of vanilla, nutmeg and maple syrup in this full-bodied, mouthcoating wine. The almost-sweet flavors and low tannins create a plush palate impression.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gnarly Head 2019 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from organic grapes, this red offers brambly red fruit, ample baking spice and notes of leather. Full bodied and weighty, it holds its acidity well, boosting the fruitiness and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Preston 2018 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This smooth and supple wine offers plenty of dark-fruit flavors on a velvety texture of light tannins, for a well-balanced expression that's easy to sip and appreciate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lost Hog 2019 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This ripe, flavorful and smooth-textured wine offers a flinty, peppery aroma followed by plump blackberry-jam flavors. A full body and a sense of slight sweetness give it breadth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tortoise Creek 2018 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Cherry jam and loads of warm spices carry the nose, with a bit of alcoholic burn peeping through but not totally taking over. The medium-bodied palate shows a nice balance between rich fruit, supple tannin and bright acidity, making this a solid representation of Primitivo di Manduria.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Claudio Quarta 2017 Antico Sigillo  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very rich and ripe, this wine goes for a Port-like expression with the addition of some late-harvest fruit. It is high in alcohol and sweetness, offering strawberry-jam and plum-syrup flavors that coat the palate and soften the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2018 Muy Bueno Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This teddy bear of a wine is very full bodied but soft and cozy in texture, offering warm cinnamon and vanilla flavors over juicy plums.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and high-octane wine is oaky, smoky and savory in flavor, offering black-pepper, toasted wood and cocoa notes wrapped in moderate tannins. It's made of 90% Zinfandel and 10% Syrah.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2018 Essenzo Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Salt and pepper flavors accompany ripe plums and a smooth texture with mild tannins in this full-bodied, mouthfilling wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Tasty and well balanced, too, this medium- to full-bodied wine offers wild-berry and ripe plum flavors accented by white pepper and sage. It's mouthfilling and not very tannic.                      Jim Gordon
Name: One Leaf 2018 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Salt and pepper flavors accompany ripe plums and a smooth texture with mild tannins in this full-bodied, mouthfilling wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This subtle, elegant wine contains around 12% each of Petite Sirah and Carignan, adding to its easy, fruity style. Soft, supple tannins give it an approachability and roundness that make it food-friendly and refined.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sauveteur 2018 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rather closed on the nose, aromas of toasted coriander seed and cocoa nibs arise with time in the glass, with a hint of a dense blackberry core riding underneath. It's luscious and rounded in feel, but not entirely expressive of fruit. A blackberry syrup flavor is framed in dark spice tones, with just enough acidity to lend support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vetrère 2016 Barone Pazzo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of cherry jam carry hefty sweet spice accents of cinnamon, anise and tobacco. The palate is rounded in feel, displaying red cherry and blackberry jam flavors balanced by bright acidity and a solid framing of tannins. It will please many with its alluring mix of ripe fruit and sweet spice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Mocavero 2018 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Strong oak aromas of charred wood and cloves dominate this deep-colored, tannic and very extracted wine. It's bold, tannic and spicy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Klinker Brick 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Flint and herb aromas lead to raspberry, black-pepper and dried cherry flavors in this full-bodied wine. It's hearty and moderately tannic.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Page Mill Winery 2018 Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Balsamic and raspberry aromas lead to very ripe, almost-sweet, dried-fruit flavors and a soft texture that belies the full body. This is a late-harvest style wine that devotees of the genre will especially enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2018 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Earthy wild-berry aromas and good, tangy raspberry flavors make this wine lively and appetizing. It will be very practical as an all-purpose house wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bota Box 2019 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick, supple layers of smoky oak, grilled meat and cedar greet the entry of this robustly built wine that is ripe and powerful in style. Tobacco, black pepper and a richness of cola round it out.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Oakville Winery 2018 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Oakville)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This plummy, chocolaty wine is soft and flavorful, low in tannins and high in ripeness and ease of sipping.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tiger Lily 2018 Reserve Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smooth, soft and easy-drinking wine features maple syrup aromas and strawberry-jam flavors that flood the palate. While full bodied, it's light in tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Caricature 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of crushed peppercorn and tilled earth are very quiet on the nose. The light-bodied palate is racy and tart, with a blackberry jam core giving it some weight. The acidity leans a bit harsh and the tannins are feathery light, providing little grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: 12 e Mezzo Made with Organic Grapes
Name: Varvaglione 2017 12 e Mezzo Made with Organic Grapes Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas and off-beat raspberry vinegar and black-pepper flavors keep this light-bodied wine out of the mainstream, but it's something different to try.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Divergent Vine 2018 Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense aromas of black currant, red flowers and charred meat are wrapped in a rocky edge on the nose of this bottling. There is great cohesion to the palate, where rich red fruits are cut by crushed stone flavors, lifted by savory spice and framed by ample acidity and tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brady Vineyard 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a spectacular showcase and field blend of several incredible sites, including Banfield (36%), Limerick Lane (23%), Soldini (18%), Bedrock (14%) and Carlisle (9%), familiar names to followers of exceptional Zin. Possessed of tension, power and surprisingly high-toned freshness, it is layered in crushed rock, iron and just-picked blackberry. The structure suggests aging; enjoy best from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2018 Marquis Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Earthy, mineral aromas and concentrated, nervy but ripe fruit flavors merge in this full-bodied, firmly textured and moderately tannic wine. Elements of dried herbs and river rocks accent deep wild-berry and roasted plum notes. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2017 Rinaldi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: First planted in 1905, this is a relatively cool-climate site that imparts great brightness and tart acidity to the wine. A dark cherry flavor is powerfully represented, alongside baked plum, blackberry and black pepper. A taut structure suggests this will do well with time in bottle. Best from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tempting mint and cinnamon aromas lead to rich, ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors that are wrapped in firm tannins. This absolutely flavor-packed wine from a truly outstanding Zin maker will reward cellaring. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2017 D'Agostini Bros. Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Meaty, black-pepper aromas and broad, concentrated wild-berry flavors are framed by a firm structure of tannins and good acidity in this brawny but well behaved wine. It's full bodied, nicely balanced on a big scale, and shows great depth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2017 E Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The producer's marquee wine and a nod to its long-standing ties to farming, this is fresh and earthy in notes of crushed rock, slate, dried herb and black pepper. The fruit is layered and sumptuous in flavors of raspberry and black cherry, while supple tannins and a hint of toasted oak provide framing.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: One of the few and oldest vineyards planted to the variety in Carneros, this wine opens in sharp, tangy cherry and strawberry flavors dusted with baking spice. Bright acidity turns up at every level, though the wine still maintains plenty of full-bodied power, concentration and a creamy texture. A finishing touch of citrus underscores its lively nature.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Valsecchi Vineyard Zinfandel (Carneros)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This complex, well-spiced but also well-balanced wine starts with subtle oak nuances of cinnamon, toast and nutmeg, then reveals a core of rich, ripe black fruits and a mouthfilling texture buoyed by a touch of grippy tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2018 Old Vine Di Stasio Vineyard Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Brawny and thick in notes of blackberry, dark cherry and cola, this wine comes from a 40-acre site of head-trained vines at the northern edge of St. Helena. A plush, opulent texture supports the powerful fruit, finishing on teases of nutmeg and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Distinctive tones of salt, pepper and sage bring this full-bodied wine to life as they accent the ripe plum and blackberry flavors. Mild tannins and a superbroad texture make this wine something over which to linger, as it no doubt reflects the 19th-century vines from which it was made.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2018 Old Vine Original Grandpère Vineyard Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Pure, delicious black-fruit flavors and a nicely firm texture make a great combination in this full-bodied, high-alcohol but well-balanced wine. Hints of mint and cedar accent the black-cherry and black-plum flavors while light tannins add a good bite to the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2018 Zinfandel (High Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Absolutely gorgeous black-fruit flavors burst out of this deep, dark, full-bodied Primitivo. It is a supergenerous, ripe and lip-smacking expression. Blackberry and black-cherry flavors practically overwhelm the palate and linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2018 Shake Ridge Ranch Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a captivatingly complex, inviting and interesting estate wine from the western edges of the appellation. It is a mix of white pepper, wild game, wild strawberry and raspberry. With texture and structure, it has a savory element of crushed rock and dust that lasts on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Tres Sabores 2017 Perspective Estate Zinfandel (Rutherford)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and nicely structured wine offers a mix of ripe blackberry and plum flavors, with light nuances of dried sage and aged beef. It's balanced, complex and distinctive.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2018 High Elevation Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick, supple tannins wrap around lifted tones of strawberry and raspberry in this wine. From a site planted in 1924, it shows the successful partnership between producer, site and ideal vintage, finding balance and nuance that impress.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Falleri Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pristine aromas of blackberry paste meet with white pepper and wet stone on the fresh nose of this bottling, which is one of the few Zinfandels from this county. Clean lines of boysenberry, fennel stalk and more pepper and stone consume the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: The Hideaway 2018 Motel Zinfandel (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick, supple tannins wrap around lifted tones of strawberry and raspberry in this wine. From a site planted in 1924, it shows the successful partnership between producer, site and ideal vintage, finding balance and nuance that impress.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Falleri Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pristine aromas of blackberry paste meet with white pepper and wet stone on the fresh nose of this bottling, which is one of the few Zinfandels from this county. Clean lines of boysenberry, fennel stalk and more pepper and stone consume the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: The Hideaway 2018 Motel Zinfandel (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Opulent fruit flavors and a firm but velvety texture make this full-bodied wine big and bold. The baking-spice, grilled plum and blackberry-syrup flavors will make it a great after-dinner pour.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2018 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This well-balanced, layered and seamless wine offers tons of fresh blackberry and raspberry flavors wrapped in a bracing texture of fine-grained tannins. Good acidity and a great sense of focus add to its charms. Interestingly, it is made from 50% Zinfandel, 30% Primitivo (the Italian strain of Zinfandel), 10% Petite Sirah and 10% Barbera.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2018 Painted Fields Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of fresh berries and crushed rocks make for a tightly wound and focused nose in this bottling. Brisk blackberry-jam and light vanilla flavors converge on the palate, which is structurally impressive, wrapped in taut tannins and solid acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Vines 2018 The Biker Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of dark berry, smoke, leather and crushed black rocks show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 9% Petite Sirah and 8% Counoise. A baked boysenberry flavor meets with dried fig and rock tones on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2018 Vortex Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 11% residual sugar, this late-harvest wine spent eight months in oak, soaking in great flavors of baked plum, prune and Christmas ginger cake. With a punch of acidity it remains vibrant and complex within its viscous concentration and supple texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dashe Cellars 2017 Lily Hill Vineyard Late Harvest Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This spicy, generous wine does a nice job of blending the baking spice and maple notes of new barrels with jazzy raspberry and strawberry flavors. Full bodied and just moderately tannic, it has a big personality.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2018 Epicenter Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy aromas of black plum remain focused and intense on the nose of this bottling. The palate is more complex, carrying flavors of roasted blackberry, black pepper, elderberry and purple flowers.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2018 Bailey Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy nutmeg, cinnamon and clove lead the way to a lively palate of red fruit and considerable power, the wine unabashedly full-bodied and fleshy. Still, acidity keeps it graceful and lively, with enduring balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bannister 2017 Saini Farms Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, mostly from 1922-planted vines, is a uniquely intellectual spin on Zinfandel, proving unlike most other takes on the grape and somewhat simple, yet constantly calling out for attention. Aromas of red plum, cranberry and light herbs lead into light strawberry, dried meat and more herb tones, as well as a hint of blood. These elements all grow more ethereal with time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Birichino 2018 Saint Georges Old Vines Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aroma of crushed blackberry, black plum and fig meet with a toasted grape-seed touch on the nose of this bottling from a historic ranch. Firm tannins and flashes of acid frame the sip, where roasted fig jam, smoked pork and light prune flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ridge 2018 Benito Dusi Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A field blend with small amounts of Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet, this hearty red is thick in interwoven tannin and brawny oak, with a plush mouthfeel throughout. Dark, brooding notes of plum, blackberry and leather lead to a nutmeg-laden finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2018 Alegria Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of dried herbs, rose petals, salt and pepper meet lively raspberry and cranberry flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine. Made by fermenting whole clusters, it has an appetizing nip of tannin to firm up the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2019 Zinster Lot 1852 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: A field blend also including Mourvèdre, Charbono and Carignan, this wine impress in its opening notes of leather and cigar. Thick and concentrated, with generous oak and tannin, it shows brooding flavors of blackberry, dark chocolate, dust and rock.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Peter Franus 2016 Brandlin Vineyard Zinfandel (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With old-vine aromas of Christmas spice, leather and mocha, this velvety wine is hearty on the palate in full-bodied concentration and power. Flavors of blackberry, cherry and cranberry dominate across a persistent richness of style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beran 2017 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine tastes rich and somewhat spicy, combining quite ripe blackberry flavors with cedar and black-pepper notes that give it a unique and attractive profile.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Concrete 2016 Tank No 209 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This rich, enveloping wine melds savory, spicy accents of tobacco and black pepper with a dense dark-berry and plum core. It's suave and seductive on the palate, with polished tannins and lifted acidity lending structure to the rich fruit. For those looking for a comforting red to enjoy in the cooler months of the year, this fits the bill.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ronco di Sassi 2016 Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Toasty spice notes are prominent on the nose, riding over a rich dark-fruit core. This red is rounded and plush in feel, with soft, pliant tannins lending just enough support to the dense dark-cherry and plum flavors. Accents of anise and vanilla add interest and give this wine lots of appeal.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tagaro 2017 Muso Rosso Collection  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A dark shade of brownish red in the glass, this 16-year-old dessert Zinfandel smells of prune, raisin, caramel and cigar wrapper, with enough alcohol to burn the nose a bit. The palate is quite balanced in texture and acidity, as lingering tannins uphold the baked prune, cola spice, leather and smoky cigar flavors rather impressively.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2004 Bolero Cellars Tesoro Del Sol Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site high above Lake Sonoma, blended with small amounts of Petite Sirah and Mourvèdre, this wine is juicy in plum and dark cherry. With a soft, integrated structure, it builds complexity in the glass, contributing savory notes of black pepper and clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutcher Crossing 2016 Pritchett Peaks Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged in French oak barrels, this 100% varietal wine opens in a lightness of baking spice, cranberry and dark cherry. Thick tannin and a touch of toasted oak make it robust on the palate, the underlying acidity subtle and solid, with length and breadth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pellegrini 2018 AV Old Vines Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This dessert wine is made from a selection of vineyards and blended with 15% late-harvest Petite Sirah. Viscous and delicious, it delivers dense flavors of baked cherry, vanilla and mocha that blend with balanced accents of baking spice and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Carol Shelton 2019 Black Magic Late Harvest Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Rich plum and focused black-cherry flavors give this well-balanced wine a tasty center that's wrapped in light tannins and a touch of good acidity. It's appetizing and well-primed for food pairings.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2017 Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Sold in three-packs, this can is made entirely from Zinfandel and aged four months in neutral French oak. With an inviting nose of cherry, blackberry and cranberry, it is dry, leathery and satisfying, with balanced fruitiness that appeals.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Baca 2019 Ring Around the Rosé of Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich and jammy with a handful of Petite Sirah, this wine offers deep layers of baked plum, prune, baking spice and vanilla. A dash of black pepper accents the lengthy, full-bodied finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2018 Hawley Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich, dark and ripe fruit aromas stop just sort of being too prominent on the nose of this bottling, which also shows some purple-flower hints. There is a firm tannic core to the sip, where dark-blackberry and gooey black-plum-sauce flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Midnight 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A rich nose of black plum, blackberry and tilled earth mixes with an orange-spice accent in this wine. The medium-bodied palate is driven by flavors of juicy plum and dark berry, pushed along by lifted acidity and a slight saline note. The tannins are soft and mellow but supportive, playing well alongside the rich fruit and warm spice tones.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Varvaglione 2016 Papale Oro  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Full in feel and firmly structured, this wine is a kind of gentle giant. It offers ripe but not overt flavors of blackberry and blueberry, with a well-polished texture despite the moderate tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael David 2018 Freakshow Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Attractive cedar and cinnamon notes from oak aging spice up this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine that has a very good core of ripe red-cherry and raspberry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2018 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
