Description: Fully developed dried-cherry flavors give this full-bodied wine made from organic grapes plenty of fruit concentration while a smooth texture and light tannins add a nice grip to the palate. It's not quite a fruit bomb, but high in ripeness and alcohol.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Barra of Mendocino 2018 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tar and iodine are at the fore of the nose, leading to a palate that's more giving in its rich black-plum and dark-berry flavors. Rich fruit and dark cocoa tones dominate the palate, all wrapped in a firm coating of tannins and juicy acidity. Warm spice flavors feel a bit heavy on the robust finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vigneti del Salento 2016 Leggenda Vigne Vecchie  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, broad and chocolaty wine tastes ripe and is quite mouthfilling. Flavors of dried plum, milk chocolate and cedar make a satisfying blend.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Lush, plummy fruit flavors mingle with more savory, meaty notes in this richly textured, full-bodied and soft-textured wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2016 The Immortal Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick in tannin and rich in mocha and marshmallow flavor, this is a ripe, robust wine seasoned in savory elements of black pepper and sage. The tannins are supportive and supple.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Trione 2016 Flatridge Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tar and iodine are dominant on the nose, with hints of violet and peppery spice chiming in. The full-bodied palate brings robust flavors of plum and blackberry jam, supported by burly tannins and firm acidity. It feels gripping and mouthcoating, but the fruit is nice and rich.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2017 Raccontami  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Superfruity and fresh, this is a very friendly, quaffable version of Zin, offering grapey, jammy flavors on a full body that doesn't feel too tough, due to light tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2019 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With an earthy opening of mushroom and forest, this is a thick, rich and dusty red wine, made from dry-farmed grapes. Bold and full bodied, it offers layers of blackberry, black cherry and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2018 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This powerful, full-bodied wine leads with a maple-syrup aroma and then offers fresh raspberry and red-cherry flavors accented by vanilla. It's mouthfilling, has light tannins and a warm finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: DNA VIneyards 2018 Mud Pie Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smooth, full-bodied and very ripe-tasting wine seems infused with clove and cedar flavors that rob attention from the blackberry notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: OZV 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Matera, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: From a region in Basilicata that boarders Puglia, this Primitivo starts off with a quiet nose of iodine and tilled earth. The medium-bodied palate begins smooth and silken in feel, with tasty red-fruit flavors holding court. However, by the finish, clenching tannins constrain the fruit and give a dry bite.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Taverna 2018 I Sassi Primitivo (Matera)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This very fruity and dry wine gushes juicy grape flavors on a medium to full body that gives it a pretty big mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: OZV 2019 Estate Grown Rosé of Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of roasted fennel and strawberry balsamic sauce. The palate is sharp with tangy acetic tones, though offers a rounded red-fruit touch in the midpalate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2016 Vienza Primitivo (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Juicy and pleasing, with undeniable complexity, this great wine tastes of brambly blackberry, cinnamon and plum accented by leather, black pepper and nutmeg. While full in feel, it shows balance and elegance. The tannins are well structured and supportive of the fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty and structured, this is a graceful version of the grape, herbal and brimming in bay leaf and black pepper. Tightly wound and firm in tannin, it shows a wealth of balanced black currant and cherry with well-integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paradise Ridge 2015 The Convict Branham Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Black cherry and plum highlight a sumptuous, smooth 100% varietal experience in this impressive vineyard-designate. Speckled in mocha and baking spice, it is lush and opulent.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dashe Cellars 2017 Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The carbonic movement has found a new candidate. This Zinfandel shows purple berry, lavender, violet and light elderberry on the nose. The palate features a tannic bite, with black pepper and peppercorn spicing up the grape-bubblegum flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stasis 2019 Carbonic Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas of crushed slate and wet wood meet with slightly charred beef and black-cherry cream on the nose of this bottling. There is a subtlety to the palate, where rounded flavors of baked cherry, strawberry and black plum converge with cardamom and nutmeg.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opolo 2018 Reserve Collection Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked black cherry, clove and light cocoa aromas show on the nose of this reserve bottling. Rich black-cherry and caramel flavors are opulent, if a tad boozy, on the palate, where plenty of clove spice carries into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opolo 2018 Reserve Collection Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a powerful and rich wine, especially for the price point. Opulent aromas of black currant and blackberry are wrapped in hickory smoke, iodine and rust on the nose. The palate packs blueberry jam, caramel and vanilla into a hearty experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClean 2018 Simone Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From a warm year, this is a concentrated, intensely full-bodied wine, given additional color and weight by 3% Petite Sirah. Black pepper, dried herb and a touch of reduction lead to an evolved, elegant thread of blackberry and strawberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fragrant earthiness lies beneath rich red-cherry, strawberry and Meyer lemon flavors in this well-integrated, colorful wine. Refreshing acidity balances out the ample tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bartholomew Estate 2019 Rosé of Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sumptuous and richly layered, this old-vine wine is deeply concentrated in fruity blackberry and cherry. Complex and wrapped in oak, it finishes in cinnamon and cola.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saini 2017 Olive Block Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep cassis and stewed strawberry aromas meet with nutmeg and rustic earth tones on the spicy and rustic nose of this bottling. Rich flavors of black-currant jam meet with loamy earth and nutmeg on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and dense with a tannic grip, this youthful, exuberant red includes 10% Petite Sirah. With a small amount of new French oak, it leads with fruity baked plum and berry flavors dusted in mocha and dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dashe Cellars 2017 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy black cherry and berry highlight a soft, succulent texture in this well-made, broadly appealing wine. With complexity and length, it retains refreshing acidity beneath hints of black pepper, cola and cinnamon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bruliam 2018 Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a soft, smoothly integrated red, blended with 2% Petite Sirah and aged 18 months in year-old puncheons. Herbal and earthy with a touch of reduction, it offers layered flavors of blackberry, cherry, black pepper and dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dashe Cellars 2017 Todd Brothers Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, concentrated, soft and simple red, full bodied and robustly appealing. Dark mocha flavors meet a burst of blackberry jam, finishing juicy and broadly seasoned in baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saini 2017 Apple Block Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Baked plum takes on a prune-like raisiny quality in this highly ripe wine, bursting in jammy cherry, too. Tight, youthful tannin add to the weight and breadth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: V. Sattui 2017 School House Creek Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designate includes 8% Petite Sirah from the same site. The wine is intensely earthy and herbal on the palate. Dark-berry fruit peeks between firm, supple tannins and lasting oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutcher Crossing 2017 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designate includes 8% Petite Sirah from the same site. The wine is intensely earthy and herbal on the palate. Dark-berry fruit peeks between firm, supple tannins and lasting oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutcher Crossing 2017 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Concentrated and fruity in black cherry and berry, this is an intensely ripe, rich wine that finishes hot in toasted oak and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mueller 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Toasted oak, leather and tobacco dominate in this wine, which has been cofermented with 2% Petite Sirah. Syrupy and thick, it tastes of jammy blackberry and plum, with a dusting of cocoa powder.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Green & Red 2016 Chiles Mill Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Dry herbaceous tannins lie beneath a thicket of concentrated black fruit in this mountain appellation red. Cigar box, leather and black pepper provide a savory backdrop of intrigue and spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Summit Lake 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a dry, tannic wine that tastes of blackberry and cola, with a thick viscosity and richness that persists. The finish adds a touch of crisp lemon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hawley 2019 Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From 85-year-old vines, this wine is herbal in eucalyptus, with a syrupy frame of jammy blackberry and dried cherry, with spice and grip. Gigantically ripe, it finishes in sweet heat.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Spicy Vines 2017 Zin Master Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Damp wood, cherry syrup and metallic aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate tightens up to present strawberry and peach-like flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ballard Lane 2018 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This massive wine made from a vineyard planted in the 1860s combines powerful ripe flavors with tons of fine-grained tannins and a very full body. Great concentration, depth and layering come with baking-spice and herb nuances. It's impressive to drink now with major proteins, but best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2016 OGP Original Grandpere Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very focused and delicious berry flavors give this full-bodied wine a satisfying palate and lingering finish, while moderate tannins and subtle oak spices like vanilla and cedar add welcome complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Deep, deep fruit flavors are accented by hints of oak, earth and dried herbs in this delicious blockbuster of a wine. It shows ripe berry and cherry flavors, full body and light tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gnarly Fox 2017 Lot 7 Estate Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This excellent wine is bold in flavor and big in structure. It offers intense blackberry and black-cherry flavors framed by firm tannins and a full body. Light accents of chaparral, vanilla and cedar add extra interest and complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2016 Catfish Vineyard Centennial Vines Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine shows excellent depth of flavor and great structure. Rich blackberry and plum notes ring clear as a bell, accompanied by light shades of oaky spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Full bodied and extremely ripe-tasting, this robust wine is packed with rich dried-plum and blackberry flavors and accented by vanilla and black pepper. It feels mouthfilling and broad, yet the light tannins keep it smooth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2017 Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a firmly structured and moderately tannic wine intended for rich grilled or roasted foods. Attractive salt and pepper aromas lead to tempting blackberry and strawberry flavors and a full body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2017 Pacini Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This rich, rounded wine is packed with delicious black-fruit flavors on a mouthfilling and lightly tannic texture. It's fruity, ripe and lip-smacking good.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shooting Star 2018 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A mix of tilled earth, violet, blackberry, plum and dried hibiscus carry this enticing Primitivo. The medium-bodied palate is driven by juicy dark fruit, with savory tones of earth, flowers and spice adding depth. The tannins show some grit, but it's nothing a hearty protein can't temper.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Botromagno 2018 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe fruit flavors dominate this bold and full-bodied wine. Powerful berry and cherry aromas spill from the glass on the nose, while the palate follows suit with rich high-octane fruit.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2018 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For a strong name like Double Black, this bottling is a lighter, balanced take on Zinfandel, starting with aromas of strawberry, crushed rocks and minty herbs. There's a pleasant snap to the sip, where raspberry, white-pepper and rose-petal flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Double Black 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich tones of blueberry and blackberry meld with a heavy dose of cocoa and coffee on the nose. It's plush and juicy on the palate, with soft tannins that allow the black fruit to shine, all the while lifted by a bright vein of acidity. Warm spice tones linger on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Apollonio 2016 Terragnolo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry, cola and wild mint aromas make for a clean, pure expression on the nose of this bottling. The baked dark-fruit flavors meet with wild sage and ripe watermelon on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hall Ranch 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale salmon color, the aromas offer notes of lees and baked bread, reminiscent of the autolytic notes of a Champagne. There's a lot of texture to the fruit and lees flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery, with the aromas holding it back a bit.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Itä 2019 Les Collines Vineyard Rosé of Primitivo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Antonio Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Somewhat light in color for a dense dessert wine, this bottling begins with candied black currant, black cherry and complex thyme aromas. The palate is very sweet and treacly, full of strawberry and licorice flavors that would work well on ice cream.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Odonata NV Wellong Vineyard Late Harvest Zinfandel (San Antonio Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Jammy fruit flavors are coated with baking spices, vanilla and chocolate in this full-bodied, rich and indulgent wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Covenant 2019 Mensch Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of blackberry and plum are lifted by accents of tilled earth and gardenia on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is driven by zesty acidity, with raspy tannins and a hint of bitter spice lingering under the lush fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2017 Punta Aquila Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is full bodied, but smooth and well behaved, offering rich plum and strawberry flavors on a broad, mouthcoating texture that is not very tannic.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Edio 2018 Estate Grown Primitivo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is indeed dry, tannic and robust on the palate, featuring strong and lasting flavors of cranberry and lemon zest.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pedroncelli 2019 Signature Selection Dry Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep, dark and gooey aromas of cassis and kirsch meet with fudge and caramel on the thick nose of this bottling. There's a lot of smoke on the palate, where sandy tannins wrap around ripe black-plum flavors in a slightly boozy show of power.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opolo 2018 Forte Reserve Collection Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of violet, dried black fruit and tilled earth carry to the smooth supple palate. The tannins are soft and the acidity is well integrated, making this an approachable easygoing red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantele 2017 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is especially ripe and jammy in flavor, oozing flavors of blackberry syrup and blueberries on a smooth texture that makes it seem sweet.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gnarly Fox 2017 Pro-voc-a-tive Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This medium- to full-bodied wine has a touch of balsamic topping its potent blackberry flavors, and moderate tannins to firm up the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gnarly Fox 2017 Moist Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wood smoke, black pepper and clove aromas lead to powerful, grapey, blackberry-like flavors in this firm and tannic wine aged in all new oak barrels. It is concentrated, oaky and mouth-puckering.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dante Robere 2017 Zinfandel (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Brandied cherries and blackberries are at the fore of this wine, with plenty of peppery spice chiming in. This is full in feel, with firm tannins and a hot finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Castello Monaci 2016 Artas Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berry, milk-chocolate, fruitcake and strong oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate gooey and ripe, as dominant cedar flavors leech through the syrupy blackberry and black-plum flavors, enhanced by a hint of chai spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2017 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied, rustic and tannic wine offers plenty of blackberry flavors and an earthy, potato-skin aroma.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This estate site is the highest elevation in the winery's portfolio, the vines steeply planted in red volcanic soil. Its minerality is front and center, as are inviting aromas of violet and tea. Balanced, bright and complex, it provides supple texture in contrast to its crisp red and black fruit, finishing in a subtle swirl of vanilla latte.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rockpile Winery 2018 Westphall Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the Cohn Estate Vineyard planted in 1970, this brambly wine retains elegance and structure within its undeniable fruitiness. Brawny in cinnamon, black pepper and dark chocolate, bright acidity keeps it balanced and poised.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benovia 2017 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged in terra-cotta amphora, this hearty wine is perfumed in white pepper and thickets of wild raspberry. Buzzy acidity keeps it fresh and balanced amidst the concentrated jammy nature of the wine, giving it enduring complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jeff Cohn 2017 Orcio Sweetwater Springs Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This estate wine is among the last picked by the producer due to the high-elevation vineyard. It tastes of blackberry, cherry, nutmeg and cola, with underlying notes of dried herb and crushed rock. The texture is velvety, with a lasting chewiness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rockpile Winery 2018 Rockpile Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tones of orange peel, cranberry and blackberry carry the nose, offering all the brambly elements of the variety. Bold, ripe and cohesive, it retains bright acidity and a nervy feel that lend balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Williams Selyem 2018 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 5% Petite Sirah, this estate wine from high-elevation vines tastes of crushed rock and tilled soil. With elegance and understated power, it delivers fresh, focused flavors of black cherry, cinnamon and chocolate, the tannins plushly layered and well integrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rockpile Winery 2018 Jack's Cabin Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Winemaker Cohn has made this wine since his days at Rosenblum Cellars, starting in 1996, and his deftness with the site shows here. Thick in blackberry jam, pepper, leather and bacon, it is thick and structured and leaves a trace of dust and black pepper as it finishes.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jeff Cohn 2017 St Peter's Church Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a smooth, textured vineyard-designate, from a hillside site, robustly opulent in red and black cherry. Black pepper, leather and tobacco weave their way in across a seamlessly integrated, complex core of varietal intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jeff Cohn 2017 Sweetwater Springs Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This engaging and robust wine has the classic varietal attributes of brambly, berry-like aromas, rich and very ripe fruit flavors, full body and a broad, softly tannic texture. It's tasty and complex, well rounded and satisfying.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2016 Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine emphasizes savory, salty, white-peppery complexity backed by a solid core of raspberry and blackberry, giving it extra dimensions that are a treat to taste.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Comartin 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is nicely ripe and nicely dry, bracing its focused raspberry and black-plum flavors with firm tannins and full body. Hints of cedar and rosemary in the aroma and on the finish add interesting complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dashe Cellars 2017 Les Enfants Terribles Mendocino Cuvée Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Gorgeous fruit flavors practically ooze from the glass in this very ripe, very tasty and full-bodied wine. Blackberry jam, strawberries and black plums flood the palate while soft tannins give a velvety texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Baca 2018 Somersault Pacini Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed rock aromas meet with ripe cassis on the mineral-driven nose of this bottling. The palate is deep and dark with blueberry pound-cake flavors as well as a touch of licorice, with a firm tension that holds into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Caliza 2017 Primitivo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This well-balanced, well-structured wine grips the palate with firm tannins and fills the mouth with ripe, focused blackberry and raspberry flavors. It's chewy, concentrated and will make a great pairing with meats, risottos and pastas.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2017 Estate Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This seductive wine shows a lot of polish and nuanced oak spices for a Zinfandel, as cinnamon, cedar and vanilla mingle with deep, dark-blackberry and black-currant flavors. Blended from various Northern California vineyards, it's laced with fine-grained tannins and will certainly improve through at least 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dashe Cellars 2018 Vineyard Select Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny and aromatic in blackberry, dark cherry and dried herb, this old-vine wine is thick and well integrated. The flavors veer from rich and broad to savory and spicy, with a lasting element of crushed rock                      Virginie Boone
Name: Williams Selyem 2018 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted blueberry and black-currant aromas are laid across wet rocks and dusted with a pinch of thyme on the rich and lush nose of this bottling, which satisfies like comfort food. The hearty blueberry and cassis flavors of the palate are layered with crushed oregano and more wild herbs.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Baca 2018 Double Dutch Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This exuberant, complex red is made from a mix of estate vineyards as well as grower sites, like Treborce and Montecillo. While it is concentrated in black cherry, its soul leans more savory and herbal to display an understated elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mauritson 2018 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a rich, brawny wine that shows class and structure. It offers dense tones of dark plum, cranberry and orange peel, with a healthy overlay of Christmas spice and gingerbread. Elongated tannins and integrated oak frame it all.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bartholomew Estate 2018 Garden Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From winemaker Rod Berglund comes this earthy, funky wine, intense in dusty, chalky tannin and well-integrated oak. The spice and leather take center stage around dense, brambly blackberry and cherry, finding a cohesive structure on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Bastoni Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blackberry and cinnamon highlight this wine's well-integrated core of oak and tannin, the spicy complexity offering lasting flavor and balance. A touch of vanilla sparks on the velvety finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fritz Underground 2017 Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This elegant red starts off with lifted tones of cherry and blackberry on the nose, dotted with hints of tilled earth and violet. It's polished yet firm on the palate, giving a solid frame for tones of crushed gravel and orange peel to shine against the berry fruit. It's accessible now, but should hold well through 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Coppi 2017 Senatore Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a 1,400-feet elevation site thick in volcanic soils, this wine is blended with 13% Petite Sirah and shows a touch of reduction on opening. It evolves to impart juicy lengths of blueberry, black cherry and licorice, with a jolt of cola, the tannins lush and plush.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Carol Shelton 2017 Rocky Reserve Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This interesting and complex wine blends savory and mineral flavors with ripe berries on a full body and smooth, non-tannic texture. The 13% Petite Sirah and 7% Barbera add depth and lift to the Zin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2018 SHR Field Blend Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With grapes grown by the Mauritson family, this wine is gritty, textured and gravely on the palate, with exuberantly full-bodied red fruit. Bringing heat and intensity to the fore, it settles into a structured finish of dusty black pepper and nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Baca 2018 Home Base Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruity, with a dusty nose of baked plum, cinnamon and prune, this wine comes from a vineyard planted between 1929 and 1949. Still in the same family, it offers bright, quenching acidity beneath the brawn and lasting heat.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Baca 2018 Tug O' War Maffei Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a hillside site where the vines are planted in solid volcanic rock, this wine is surprisingly bright and inviting blue and red fruit. Thick and rich on the palate, it has powerfully firm, structured tannin to support the concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jeff Cohn 2017 Iron Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From head-trained vines, this wine is thick, concentrated and richly layered in red and black berry and cherry. High-toned acidity lifts the density of the fruit as shocks of black pepper, nutmeg and leather weigh in.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2018 Todd Brothers Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump and ripe aromas of black cherry, toast and spicy pepper kick off the nose on this bottling. Roasted black-currant and nutmeg flavors arise on the sip, which is thick with tannins, balanced in acidity and finishes on a vanilla tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opaque 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Cohesive aromas of tilled earth, tobacco and peppery spice are well-integrated into a rich cherry jam core on the nose. This is full, rounded and juicy in feel, showing luscious fruit jam flavors that don't falter or loose definition, thanks to lifted acidity and a firm framing of polished tannins. Tobacco, earth and violet tones bring added depth, with a cherry skin tone lingering on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2017 Lirica  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a cool, mentholated quality to the nose that sits over the concentrated yet fresh blackberry jam and dark cherry core. Tense tones of thick-skinned dark cherry and blackberry carry the palate. The tannins are firm in feel, but there's plenty of fruit to fill it out. Spice, violet and orange rind accents lend lift, with lingering tones of iodine and jammy berry fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2017 Triusco  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a tiny production field blend led by Zin with smaller amounts of Alicante Bouschet, Carignan, Petite Sirah and Golden Chasselas. Cofermented, it was given 14 months in French oak, a minority new. Baked red fruit, spicy cinnamon and sweet oak contribute soft, rounded layers of flavor boosted by underling acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seawolf 2018 Marcucci Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For a wine from vines planted in 1906, this bottling is full of youthful vibrancy rather than austere elegance. Buoyant aromas of boysenberry syrup, nutmeg and mace are ripe but fresh, while the palate's blueberry-compote, black-pepper and licorice flavors are playful and juicy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eden Rift 2018 Dickinson Block Zinfandel (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spicy bramble berry, blood orange and violet start off this fresh, focused red. The palate is medium in weight and juicy in flavors of tart cherry and red plum. Acidity is the main driver here, but a firm frame of tannins lends support, yielding a polished, delicious outcome.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Coppi 2017 Don Antonio Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 22% Petite Sirah and 1% Carignan, this thick, full-bodied wine is robust in feel. Cranberry, plum and blackberry give the fruit a tangy brightness before finishing touches of cola and cinnamon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2018 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Voluptuously over the top in style and approach, this wine offers velvety concentration and sweet heat, with bursting red fruit. From a dry-farmed, head-trained site farmed organically and biodynamically, it threads a needle of bright acidity throughout the ripeness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Baca 2018 I Spy Black Sears Vineyard Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Mocha and nutmeg season a soft, restrained and elegant core of blueberry and candied plum in this well-made wine. From vines planted in the 1800s, this Zin was cofermented with Sémillon, Muscadelle and Palomino.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rock Wall 2018 Maggie's Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This rich wine is all about succulent blackberry jam, cocoa powder and sizzling warm spices. There's a creamy, polished feel to it all, while lifted acidity keeps it balanced and enticing. Tilled earth and fruit go hand-in-hand on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2018 Torcicoda Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From vines averaging 100 years in age, this hearty wine brings blackberry jam, vanilla and black cherry to the fore. Thick tannins support a full-bodied palate, highlighted in black pepper and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A dense nose of tart cherry and violet gives way to a plush, rounded palate of rich fruit-jam intensity. This shows a good progression of fruit, spice and floral tones, while a polished frame of tannins lends support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: San Marzano 2018 Talò  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Fountaingrove District, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From dry-farmed, century-old vines, this wine is richly ripe in plum and black cherry, with a hot and heavy presence tempered by a lift of acidity. Dusty tannin and tobacco ride out the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Loach 2017 Riebli Valley Vineyard Zinfandel (Fountaingrove District)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tilled earth, geranium and Mediterranean scrub ride over a pure, concentrated core of fresh blackberry and currant in this wine. It's smooth and supple on the palate, with a polished, easy feel to the crunchy berry flavors and earthy accents. This is a harmonious Primitivo that shows the grape's savory, fresh side.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pietraventosa 2017 Volere Volare Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Lifted aromas of crushed black pepper, tar, violet and cherry carry the nose of this single-vineyard wine. The palate is broad and rich in cherry and red plum flavors, with loads of spice, violet and herbal nuances. There's a bit of a fiery kick to this high-octane Primitivo, but is resolves well on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Polvanera 2015 17 Vigneto Montevella Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich cherry and blackberry jam aromas kick off the nose while bubblegum spice chimes in. This is rounded and full on the palate, with juicy, soft black and red fruit flavors. Plenty of lift from zesty acidity gives this ample brightness, while a soft framing of tannins rides throughout. It's a style that will please a crowd: silken yet juicy fruit, supple tannins and a heady dose of warm spices.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amarama 2018 Appassimento Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Fountaingrove District, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A field blend composed of 12% Alicante Bouschet, 8% Petite Sirah and 3% Carignan, this wine is complex and layered, tasting of mocha chocolate, sweet oak, nutmeg and cinnamon. The fruit is dark and brambly, richly defined in blackberry and black cherry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Carol Shelton 2016 Karma Bastoni Vineyard Zinfandel (Fountaingrove District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an excellent, smooth and very ripe-tasting semisweet wine that is full bodied and has a touch of tannin to balance its lavish red- and black-fruit flavors. True to the late-harvest style, it turns sweet in mouthfeel and on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2018 Late Harvest Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Made in a light, bright style, this elegant wine is tangy and spicy, aged in neutral oak. Sweet tobacco, black cherry and plum hit the palate with restraint.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lola 2018 Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Valle d'Itria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tar, iodine and violet are dense on the nose, with loads of peppery spice and bramble berries at the core of this wine. It's rich on the palate in flavors of dark-berry jam and orange marmalade, yet a sturdy frame of gripping tannins and pulsing acidity keeps it balanced. There's good integration and power here.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tagaro 2015 Piè del Monaco Primitivo (Valle d'Itria)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of dark cherry jam, anise and orange spice make for an inviting nose. It's rounded and plump on the palate, displaying well-balanced yet hefty tones of jammy dark fruit and sweet spices. It ends lifted and bright, making it accessible in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Giordano 2018 Appassimento Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Winemaker Greg La Follette has created a wine with a slight reductive edge, opening in thick, intensely concentrated flavors of dark plum, blackberry and cherry. Tobacco and nutmeg season a juicy underbelly of bold richness that lasts on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ancient Oak Cellars 2016 Pagnano Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Showing the earthier side of the variety, this red starts off with aromas of turned soil, crushed black pepper and violet on the nose, yet there's plenty of added appeal in the ripe berry core. It's rounded and full on the palate without being overblown, giving way to juicy blackberry and dark-plum flavors that linger nicely on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2018 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is such a solidly made, ultimately drinkable wine at such a value-minded price that it is hard to resist. Smoky dark chocolate meets thick blackberry jam as a lift of brightness keeps it balanced and lengthy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Delta 2018 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an organically farmed site, this full-bodied, ultraripe wine is pruney and viscous, with meaty elements alongside vanilla oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jeff Cohn 2017 Rossi Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Pretty aromas of violet and pink peppercorn ride over the raspberry jam and cherry core. It's smooth and supple in feel, with plenty of juicy red fruit to fill it out, while spice and floral tones add depth. Crunchy cherry skins linger on the close of this delicious lighter-styled Primitivo.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Coppi 2016 Siniscalco Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a very good, richly flavored wine, quite full bodied and generously spiced, with vanilla and brown sugar notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2018 Home Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Warm spices are at the fore of this, with tar, peppery spice and violet accents that are ensconced in the dense bramble berry jam core. Medium in weight, the palate offers lifted fruit tones, with an earthier undercurrent of tilled soil, violet and warm spices. The acidity is bright and poised while the tannins offer a bit of grit, but overall it all resolves well.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Trullo di Pezza 2017 Mezzapezza Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Warm spices are at the fore of this, with tar, peppery spice and violet accents that are ensconced in the dense bramble berry jam core. Medium in weight, the palate offers lifted fruit tones, with an earthier undercurrent of tilled soil, violet and warm spices. The acidity is bright and poised while the tannins offer a bit of grit, but overall it all resolves well.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Trullo di Pezza 2017 Mezzapezza Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of crushed black pepper, violet and tilled earth are front and center on the nose, with blackberry jam and blood orange riding underneath. This is juicy and full on the smooth palate, lifted by bright shots of tart cranberry. It shows a lot of appeal upfront, but ends a bit short on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2018 Orion Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Notes of violet, gardenia and tilled earth are at the fore of the savory nose. Peppery spice and a hint of baking spice bring up the rear, with juicy red berries filling out the core of the nose. This is tense on the palate, showing lots of dark cocoa-dipped cherry flavors alongside bracing acidity and a firm grip of tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2018 Il Rosso dei Vespa  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of three vineyards, this bottling begins with rustic aromas of tangy cranberry, richer strawberry and charred fennel. Those roasted fruit flavors meet with a touch of oak and dusting of star anise on the palate, which is framed by decent acidity and noticeable tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eberle 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich cherry and blackberry aromas meld with violet and tilled earth tones on the nose. The palate shows a dried fruit character, with shots of orange rind and bright acidity to lend lift. This is an approachable Primitivo that should be enjoyed in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amastuola 2017 Centosassi Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A well-rounded nose offers aromas of ripe cherry and blackberry, sprinkled with hints of well-integrated spice tones—both savory and sweet. The medium-bodied palate is fleshed out and juicy in berry tones, lifted by accents of blood orange and violet, all framed in a gentle webbing of tannins. It's a well-structured yet approachable offering that will please many.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2018 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A rather reserved nose eventually opens up to cinnamon and orange peel, with purple blossoms and cranberry riding underneath. This is ultralight in feel on the palate, driven by zesty acidity that rounds out to juicy flavors of tart strawberry and cherry. The fruit does linger a bit on the finish, but it's a bit one-note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua 2018 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Muddled blueberry, clove and nutmeg aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is thick and heavy with flavors of blackberry paste, backed up by loads of baking spice and oak.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opolo 2018 Mountain Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A bright nose of orange spice, blackberry and dark cherry jam carries accents of anise and violet. This is supple and smooth on the palate, displaying polished fruit jam tones alongside shots of blood orange and warm spice. A bit of warmth shows on the palate, and it ends a little astringent, but overall this is enjoyable for its forward nature.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Borgo del Mandorlo 2018  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Taking the American moniker for the grape variety—a tribute to the wine's use of American oak—this wine offers dark cherry fruit tones that are firmly ensconced in accents of coffee and dark cocoa. It's rich on the palate, fully fleshed out by the lush fruit tones, with oaky spice showing good integration.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tagaro 2017 Passo del Sud Zinfandel (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of cherry cordial, brandy-soaked blackberry and a wealth of warm spices kick off the rich nose. It's rounded and ripe on the palate, echoing the nose but adding in a dense blackberry jam tone. It's all lifted by refreshing acidity, framed by well-mannered tannins and studded with spice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tratturi 2018 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a soft, round and approachable wine, boldly ripe and lush on the palate. Vanilla and black cherry dominate in flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gallo Signature Series 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a lushly concentrated and ripe wine, viscously textured and rich in cherry and vanilla. The oak takes on a sweetness that lingers.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kokomo 2018 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of date and fig are followed by front-loaded flavors that trail toward the warm finish. The fruit seems quite evolved. Drink now.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Forgeron 2017 Alder Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Abundant baking spices and a touch of wood smoke dominate the aroma of this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine, while jammy fruit flavors come out on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2018 Merrill Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Jammy, almost sweet flavors and a wild berry component give this medium-bodied and non-tannic wine plenty of varietal character uncompromised by oaky flavors. It bursts with fruitiness and freshness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2018 Spanish Creek Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep, dark and oaky aromas of black cherry, toast, vanilla and caramel are quite ripe and woody on the nose of this bottling. There is more lushness to the palate, where those same exact elements are all at play.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maddalena 2018 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked cherry, seared blackberry, a hint of herbs and a bit of charcoal show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite young and unrefined still, with roasted blackberry and tar flavors, and stiff tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rabble 2017 Mossfire Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of toasted vanilla, anise and clove carry over the rich dark berry jam core. This is full in feel on the palate, with oak tones firmly wrapping around the coiled dark-berry fruit. While there is a lot of oak, the fruit is still there to flesh it out. It's a full, flashy and rich style.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Trullo di Pezza 2017 Licurti  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Gigantically ripe and concentrated, this wine is thick and rich in tar, blackberry syrup and dark chocolate. It finishes velvety and sweet in tobacco leaf.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mount Peak 2017 Rattlesnake Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked cherry, seared blackberry, a hint of herbs and a bit of charcoal show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite young and unrefined still, with roasted blackberry and tar flavors, and stiff tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rabble 2017 Mossfire Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A warm spice tone reminiscent of Chinese five-spice powder is ensconced in the ripe cherry and blackberry tones of this wine. It's smooth and silken on the palate, with creamy berry flavors that are lifted by zesty acidity. Well-mannered tannins support it all, giving this a vibe that will appeal to many.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Castello Monaci 2018 Pilùna Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Caramel, char, toasty barrel-spice and cherry aromas lead to ripe red-fruit and coffee flavors that are light through the middle. The variety seems hard to find.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Catman 2017 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of balsamic-dipped cherries, tar and rubber carry the nose, while the plush, rounded palate offers more appeal in rich blackberry flavors. Oak and tannins are in full force, with just enough fruit weight and acidity to balance it all out.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2016 Visellio Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright, bouncy aromas of cherry and cranberry mix with integrated warm spice tones on the nose. It's silky in feel on entry, with flavors of juicy spiced blackberry lifted by violet. Mildly clenching tannins give a bit of grip and bite, but this rounds out well come the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amastuola 2018 Organic Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of balsamic-dipped cherries, crushed black pepper and anise form the nose of this accessible red. It's light and zesty on the palate, driven by jammy cherry and blackberry flavors that are lifted and pure. Fine tannins lend some grip to the feel, while an orange marmalade tone arises on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2018 Nèprica Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright, easy aromas of cherry coulis and blackberry jam form the nose, alongside integrated tones of violet and peppery spice. Medium in weight, the palate is smooth and juicy in rich cherry and berry flavors, with an accent of tar and spice. The tannins are mellowed and polished, while the acidity lively and bright. It's not very complex, or intense, but is still quite enjoyable and balanced.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Verso 2019  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of cherry, berry and bubblegum spices carry lots of intensity on the nose. This is full and fruity on the palate, showing a supple, juicy mouthfeel of cherry and berry flavors. It doesn't offer much else, but is a well-balanced, tasty offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Danti 2017 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Very lively aromas of cherry and bubblegum spice carry the nose, while the palate is equally fruit driven. Gentle tannins give a frame to the soft cherry-laden body, with juicy acidity and orange spice tones lifting it all up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2019 Il Bruno di Vespa Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This full, fleshy red is built by strong seams of cocoa and anise alongside a rich dark-berry jam core. Polished tannins and lifted acidity lend ample structure, but the warm spice dominate the fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amastuola 2017 Lamarossa Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of dried cranberry and red cherry meld with hints of tilled earth and violet on the nose. It's light and juicy on the palate, with a mix of tart red and black berry flavors that carry a slight raisinated edge. The acidity is persistent and fresh, keeping everything lifted until the brisk, spicy close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vigneti del Salento 2018 I Muri Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers earthy, funky, black peppery aromas followed by good blackberry and strawberry flavors on a rich texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Earthy and black-peppery aromas lead to mostly oaky flavors of cedar, maple, brown sugar and plums in this full-bodied, and moderately tannic wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tortoise Creek 2018 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is sourced from an estate site planted to 100-year-old vines, with half the parcel head-trained and the other half trained on a high wire, thus the name. Tangy orange peel, cherry and blackberry mesh around a densely layered core. It's complex and rich, but buoyed by bright acidity and a shock of white pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2018 Highwire Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged in all French oak, 56% of it new, Dina Arata's old-vine site contributes soft supple waves of mocha, coffee and black-cherry-berry flavors. Juicy lengthy tannins and generous oak give it power and substance within a graceful buoyancy and lasting freshness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2018 Dina's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a low-yielding, head-trained vineyard planted more than a century ago, this wine tastes of dried fruit, dust and nutmeg, with a depth of rich black cherry. Leathery texture leads to an elegant length of velvety softness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2018 Hartford Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine from a special spot in the producer's Endeavour Vineyard is brambly in black cherry, blackberry and mocha. Structured, integrated and soft in tannins, it shows a touch of grip around a core of lush fruit and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2016 Spencer's Hill Vineyard Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine includes small amounts of Peloursin, Negrette, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Carignan, showing the diversity of the historic site. A bright cherry tone mixes with tar and baking spice, with a firm weight and structured tannins that center around a chewy, grippy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2017 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty sage, earth and leather exude out of 100-plus-year-old vines from this famous dry-farmed site in the heart of the appellation. The fruit is intensely brambly and feral, a mix of blackberry, black cherry and dark fig with dustings of cocoa powder and clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2018 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This spicy and impressively concentrated wine is built for a rich meal. Cinnamon, nutmeg and black-plum aromas lead to deep, layered and focused flavors of black fruits and tamarind. Plenty of fine-grained tannins add structure for aging. Best through 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carol Shelton 2017 Cox Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 12% Petite Sirah and 2% Alicante Bouschet, this red is built by sinewy tannins and flavors of baking spice, dried herb, currant and oak. The medium-bodied frame is lifted by tart orange and raspberry flavors.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Four Clones Vineyard DCV2 Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The producer's only non-estate wine, this hails from some tremendous grower sites, including Faloni, Buchignani and Montecillo. It excels in thick tannins and black pepper, leather and black currant. It offers plenty of structure and intensity, with balanced ripeness and a lasting taste of sweet oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mauritson 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This historic vineyard showcases Zinfandel in its best light, beginning with aromas of black cherry, cola, herbs and a clay-like minerality. The palate is complex in both the chalky texture and the array of flavors, running from blueberry and fig to tobacco and a long spicy finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Hall 2017 Dusi Vineyard Cavern Select Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This appellation wine comes from a blend of five vineyard-designated sites, all old vine, dry farmed and low yielding. Velvety and expansive on the palate, it has broad appeal in its rich density of cherry, strawberry and fleshy texture. Supple tannins and integrated oak allow a finishing touch of white pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Extremely focused and concentrated fruit flavors light up this terrific wine. It's full bodied and lively textured, and was fermented on native yeast and aged in non-new barrels. Bright raspberry and rich blackberry mingle nicely, accented lightly with baking spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2017 The Native Estate Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Head-trained old vines give this wine substantial concentration and a soft fleshy core of lush dark-berry fruit. Nutmeg and black pepper give it a contrast of savory and sweet seasoning wrapped in well-integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hartford 2018 Jolene's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine from a historic vineyard offers lifted tones of cranberry and herb alongside well-integrated acidity. Full bodied in style, it offers dark chocolate and toffee notes in contrast to the brighter elements.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2017 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Savory and complex in flavor, this full-bodied wine leads with aromas of dried sage, baked earth and black pepper that are followed by white-peppery, floral, meaty flavors that are distinctive and enticing. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2016 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Appealing, hyperpure aromas of cranberry, raspberry and spice are followed by rich, full-bodied, layered, palate-coating red fruit flavors that lead to a long warm, finish. It's everything there is to love about this variety. Zinophiles, this one is for you.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Two Vintners 2017 Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Deeply aromatic, this offers hints of bouillon, meat and grilled mushroom, earthy and profuse. The palate delves deeper into rich dark chocolate and baking spice, complemented by vanilla oak and a hint of cola. Robust tannins give it additional power and density within balanced acidity and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rockpile Winery 2017 Jack's Cabin Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an unexpected floral elegance to the nose of this bottling, with hints of potpourri playing alongside the more standard roasted red-fruit aromas. The palate aims for freshness, combining strawberry and hibiscus with a hint of rose petal.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2018 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Precise aromas of strawberry sorbet meet with a bit of smoke and a pinch of baking spice on the nose of this bottling. There's a strong amount of smoke on the palate, with lots of hickory spice, but also clove, star anise, rich red-fruit and barbecued pork flavors, making this an excellent pairing for the summer grill party.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2018 Especial Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich, layered and brimming in dense plum, baked fig and blueberry, this is a spicy, robust and mineral-driven red wine. With softened tannins and integrated oak, it allows the fruit to speak loudest, with well-seasoned accents and plenty of length on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Baca 2017 Cat's Cradle Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Abundant oak spices complement deep, ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied, moderately tannic, classic wine. It has good heft on the palate and pours out cinnamon, vanilla and wood-smoke accents to enhance the good blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cedarville 2017 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Structured and mineral-driven in crushed rock and earth, this is an intense red wine that offers length and breadth. Complex black currant, blackberry and dark chocolate wrap around tangy acidity that refreshens and brightens. Still, this could stand some time in the cellar; enjoy best from 2022 through 2027. This is the last vintage of this wine as the vineyard has been replanted to Cabernet Sauvignon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rockpile Winery 2017 Cemetery Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: From a warm site in the middle of the appellation—a head-trained site that remains family-owned—this red is thick and grainy, with elements of tomato leaf and tobacco. It has a tempered richness of dark cherry and cola that contrasts well with the firm focused tannin and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2017 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black-plum, blackberry and toasty oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The medium-bodied palate is framed by solid acidity and thin yet firm tannins, delivering roasted meat and smoked berry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Adelaida 2017 Michael's Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Intriguing, complex herb, olive and cedar aromas give instant interest to this full-bodied wine made from organic grapes. Ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors follow, framed by moderate tannins for an appetizing grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Barra of Mendocino 2017 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Spicy, charred oak aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied, tannic and mouthfilling wine, but it has the ripeness to back these up. The color is dark and deep, the aromas peppery and toasted, and the black-fruit flavors mingle nicely with a rich layer of fine-grained tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael David 2017 Earthquake Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Fruity, rich and moderately spicy, this is an easy wine to sip and enjoy. It offers well-concentrated blackberry flavors, mild tannins and full body, without feeling heavy or tasting too sweet.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dancing Crow 2018 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied black raspberry, puréed strawberry and a pleasant hint of prune start off this bottling from a historic vineyard. It is dry and complex on the palate, where marjoram, tobacco leaf and black pepper spice up the mulberry jam core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2017 Dante Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is nice and dry, packed with blackberry and black-pepper flavors and layered with fine-grained tannins. It shows very good concentration, depth and structure. Best through 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2017 Zinfandel (High Valley)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This mature-tasting, complex and alluring wine has a warm, broad mouthfeel and ample raspberry and black-plum flavors. Its velvety texture shaped by fine-grained tannins give the wine an extra-smooth mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Karine 2018 Three Daughters Estate Grown Primitivo (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smashed strawberries and blackberries make for a fruit jubilee on the nose of this fairly priced bottling, which also shows hints of fennel frond. It's much drier on the palate, where alpine-strawberry-sorbet flavors meet with subtle parsley and licorice elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Vines 2017 The Biker Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a grown-up wine that offers more than simply fruit or oak and boasts a good, moderately tannic texture that's quite appetizing. It develops nice complexity on the palate, showing blackberry, black pepper and a touch of tobacco.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2018 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Richness of flavor and a good, lip-smacking texture come together nicely in this full-bodied, wonderfully juicy and lightly spicy wine. Cinnamon, vanilla and cedar accent the black cherry and blackberry flavors, while moderate tannins give good grip to the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2017 Mohr Fry Ranch Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied plum and berry aromas are an easy-to-like, relatively light entry to the nose of this bottling. Ripe black-currant and blackberry jam flavors sit atop of and underlying the tannic structure, with ample dried oregano, thyme and sagebrush elements and a kick of orange rind on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zenaida Cellars 2017 Zinfandel (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A lavish but balanced oak character brings this full-bodied wine enticing baking-spice aromas, velvety tannins and a sense of saturation that enhances the dark blueberry and blackberry fruit at its core. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Epicenter Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From Oak Knoll sites near the winery, this bold red is tight in focused tannins and a firm texture. Lifted red fruit dominates—a mix of cherry and raspberry—dipped in dried herb, baking spice and vanilla oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2017 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very ripe and luscious, this full-bodied Zin oozes rich berry-jam flavors on a smooth mouthfilling texture that has a touch of good tannin for grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carol Shelton 2017 Wild Thing Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Struck stone and light raspberry aromas make for an intriguingly light entry on the nose of this bottling. The crushed rock minerality extends to the sip, where scorched earth, wild thyme and coffee-bean flavors meet with a dried blackberry core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vintage Cowboy 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From head-trained vines of the Dusi clone, this bottling from a new vineyard is exuberant on the nose in rich aromas of berry, black plum, fig and raisin, lifted by star anise and gingerbread spice. The palate is thick and jammy but sliced with acidity, showing strong berry, clove and cinnamon flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2017 Paper Street Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from 100% whole-cluster grapes via carbonic maceration, the vineyard planted in 1885, this is an indeed fresh and fruity take on the variety that benefits from its processing. Light, crunchy red fruit presents as textured, exotic, herbal and full of bubbly acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whipsmart Wine Company 2018 One Fine Morning Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Raspberry and plum-jam flavors and a big smooth texture make this wine tempting and delicious. Full body meets soft tannins for a mouthfilling effect that carries those great fruit flavors and peppery accents through the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2018 Whiplash Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark strawberry, turned soil and a sweet cherry-wood-smoke tone show on the nose of this bottling from the iconic and pioneering winery. Blackberry and cracked pepper flavors ride a mellow texture on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2018 Willow Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Robust and complex, this full-bodied and well-balanced wine offers subtle oak spices on the nose. The palate brings berry, cherry and cedar flavors that are woven with a gripping texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Black pepper, nutmeg and ash combine around thick tannins and prominent oak in this robust red wine. The fruit is tangy and bright in cranberry and pomegranate, contrasting well against the savory introduction.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hendry 2016 Primitivo (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Dark and concentrated but easy on the palate, this full-bodied wine oozes blackberry jam and warm blueberries, while coating the mouth with a layered, concentrated texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Identified 2018 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Full body and a firm mouthfeel give this wine a big presence, supporting deep blackberry and black-plum flavors. Smooth tannins enhance the texture and a chocolaty note emerges on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Artezin 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Big, bold and spicy, this full-bodied wine boasts beef, black pepper and grilled plum flavors that are wrapped in moderate tannins for good grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gnarly Head 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
