Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Port-style wine offers plenty of sunbaked, dried-fruit flavors, oak spices like cedar and vanilla, elevated alcohol and a generously sweet balance. It will be nice as an after-dinner drink.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Karine 2016 Late Harvest Three Daughters Gemini Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a big, bold, very ripe wine whose rich berry and raisin flavors verge on sweet. It's not very tannic, but smooth and broad on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2016 Cross Creek Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strongly extracted aromas of black currant make for a dark and ripe entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit tangy with tart blackberry flavors, which are enhanced by cracked pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Joughin Vineyard Primitivo (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Effusive fruit aromas and rich juicy berry and roast-beef flavors dominate this full-bodied and lightly tannic wine. It's an enjoyable pour that shows how extroverted this varietal can be.                      Jim Gordon
Name: WIndstorm 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Effusive fruit aromas and rich juicy berry and roast-beef flavors dominate this full-bodied and lightly tannic wine. It's an enjoyable pour that shows how extroverted this varietal can be.                      Jim Gordon
Name: WIndstorm 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Fresh, honest and ripe raspberry aromas lead to delicious and concentrated red- and black-fruit flavors and a nice, firm texture in this medium-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2017 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Herbal, with a hint of eucalyptus and sage, this robust wine is funky and earthy with a simplicity of baked plum and black-cherry flavor. Full bodied, it shows a softness of tannin and well-integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sail to Trail WineWorks 2015 Cuvee 1 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smooth dry wine has amazing fruit concentration from the first whiff to the lingering grapey finish. Blackberry, blueberry and boysenberry flavors crowd the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tortoise Creek 2017 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry, caramel and fennel aromas show on the very ripe nose of this bottling. There is a strong cedar and pine-needle kick to the palate, which also shows roasted strawberry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2017 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 25% Mourvèdre, this hearty red wine is thick, decadent and richly peppery, with contrasting flavors of cherry, vanilla and raisin cake. The finish underscores the richness in a hit of dark chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Spann Vineyards 2016 Six Barrels Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumed in black-cherry liqueur and brown sugar, this is richly dense, full-bodied and lushly textured red wine, with a tension of bright acidity that lingers on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Wine Guerrilla 2017 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Tempting flavors of vanilla, coconut and milk chocolate meet strawberry and raspberry-jam notes in this broad-textured and full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Designation: Pizazz Zin Piazza Ranch Old Vine
Name: Carol Shelton 2018 Pizazz Zin Piazza Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied bold wine is packed with ripe blackberry, dried plum and boysenberry flavors that ride a smooth, lightly tannic texture. It's jammy and exuberant.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bonterra 2017 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sanguine, plummy and brimming in dried cherry, this is a lush, rich and robustly ripe wine, accented in dried herb, licorice and leather. Intensely flavored and sweet in oak, it finishes with soft approachability.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pezzi King 2016 Rockpile Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Significant char, cedar and clove flavors give this wine an oaky cast, while nice blackberry and vanilla notes and moderate tannins stay in the background.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peltier 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of dried and macerated cranberry, raspberry and fruit leather, seeming a bit advanced. Full-bodied, jammy fruit flavors follow, with a nice lick of acidity pulling it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Masset Winery 2015 Primitivo (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: So ripe that it tastes sweet, this full-bodied but soft-textured wine oozes blueberry and strawberry flavors that coat the palate. There is very little tannin and an almost sugary finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Old Soul 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripe and jammy in flavor, this full-bodied wine verges on sweet, emphasizing vanilla and milk-chocolate aromas, a rich, plummy flavor and soft texture that's low in tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cline 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Good structure and balance allow generous fruit flavors to shine through light oak spices in this medium-bodied, attractive wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dancing Bull 2017 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Very ripe, fruity and not tasting like barrels or Bourbon, this high-octane wine overflows with uncomplicated raspberry and blackberry flavors on a smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 1000 Stories 2017 Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Earthy, chocolatey notes coat the plum and blackberry flavors of this full-bodied and soft-textured wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hunted 2017 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers strong oaky smoky aromas and an almost sweet dose of oak on the palate, hiding much of the strawberry and blackberry flavors underneath.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2016 BBQ Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Spicy-sweet impressions dominate this oaky, rich and rather soft-textured wine. Strong cedar and baking-spice notes accompany ripe strawberry and raspberry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carnivor 2017 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine serves up jammy aromas and fresh berry flavors lightly accented by oak spices. It's relatively simple but well balanced and tasty.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers earthy, oaky aromas, rich and almost syrupy fruit flavors and a smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hullabaloo 2016 Old Vines Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A powerful smoky, oaky aroma and an equally smoky flavor dominate this medium-bodied and rather tannic wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Leese-Fitch 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is earthy rather than fruity and offers an aroma of cured meat followed by a flavor like grilled plums and herbs. It's medium bodied and relatively smooth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2014 The Immortal Zin Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Anise and roasted blackberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is plenty of oak on the sip, which delivers a mezcal-like impression, alongside anise and thyme flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2017 Winemaker's Select Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is very dry, quite tannic and a bit lean in terms of fruit flavor. Smoky, earthy and roasted veggie flavors give it a rustic expression.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2017 Biodynamic Estate Grown Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an estate vineyard in the famous appellation, this is the producer's third vintage of this wine. Juicy in black cherry, it has complexity and structure to spare amidst silky-smooth tannins and appealing elements of nutmeg, clove and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 DCV8 Farmhouse Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is from an eastern-facing ranch at the eastern edge of the appellation, and blended with 18% Petite Sirah. It is supple and strong in a wealth of red cherry and currant flavors. Tight and grippy at first, it opens into a lush landscape of refined opulence, seasoned in clove and nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Somers Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from two certified-organic vineyard sites and blended with 21% Petite Sirah. The whole is juicy in strawberry, blackberry, dried herb and clove, with plenty of grip and oak to make it substantial and structured. Dust and crushed rock provide complementary complexity and savory length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Quivira 2017 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This giant wine offers serious meaty, peppery aromas and absolutely mouthfilling blackberry and grilled beef flavors that are wrapped in firm tannins. Mineral and metallic accents compete for attention with wood smoke and black pepper. Best through 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2017 Barrel 32 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This bold and ripe-tasting wine feels layered and creamy, and packs plenty of blackberry and raspberry flavors on a full body. It retains a smooth texture that's tightened just enough with a touch of tannin. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2017 Block 10 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, high-octane wine is seductive, layered and complete, filling a big frame of firm tannins with equally big, but also complex flavors of blackberry, strawberry, chocolate and tobacco.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2017 Estate Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Delicious, mouthfilling flavors of just-crushed blackberries and raspberries give this wine a big presence, while a full body and moderate tannins are firm enough to balance the juicy, boisterous fruit.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2017 Lily Hill Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is full in body and rather subtle in flavor at first, but it gradually reveals complex mineral, earth, tea and tobacco nuances that keep going through the finish. It's not a superripe style, leaning more toward the earthy side of the variety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2017 Mountain Selection Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 14% Petite Sirah, this wine impresses in its offerings of dense cherry, berry and crushed rock. A succulent midpalate is softly textured and smoothly decadent, refined in lasting notes of black pepper and coffee bean.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Vogensen Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine mounts ultraripe blackberry and boysenberry on a big frame of alcohol and tannins for maximum palate impact. It is concentrated, brambly, deep and bold in flavor. Best through 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2017 Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich, ripe and full bodied, this powerful and concentrated wine overflows with blackberry jam, and peppery spices. It's moderately tannic, providing good texture and mouthfeel to back up the opulent fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2017 Florence Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of black cherry and turned loam make for a focused nose on this bottling. Full flavors of dark red fruit meet with oak smoke on the palate, making for a clean and big expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McPrice Myers 2018 Pound for Pound Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This youthful approachable wine has 15% Petite Sirah and tiny amounts of other varieties like Malbec, Mourvèdre and Montepulciano. Aged in French, American and Hungarian oak, it offers grip and oak around tart, rounded flavors of cranberry, strawberry and orange.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Quivira 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This smooth, yummy wine blends black-plum and milk-chocolate flavors for a supple, rich profile. It's full bodied, light in terms of tannin and seems to melt in the mouth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2017 Rocks Edge Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of cedar and leather recall a rustic cabin on the nose of this bottling, which also offers a dried cherry core. The cedar continues to the sip, where roasted red-fruit flavors meet with a touch of pine needle and a slightly resinous texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opolo 2018 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This silky, seductive wine from a historic vineyard blends ripe, almost sweet, dried plum flavors with milk chocolate for a rich sensation on the palate. It is a smooth wine ideal to enjoy on its own, or at the end of a meal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2017 Vineyard 1869 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied but smooth-textured wine is mossy in aroma, reasonably rich and ripe in flavor and has a good base of moderate tannins to add grip to the mouthfeel. It's a fine example of an old-vine wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Three 2017 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine emphasizes woody, spicy elements in the aromas of black pepper and sawn oak, and in the beefy, Worcestershire flavors. It delivers a big palate impact, as oakiness tends to override fruitiness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2016 Clockspring Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A strong aroma of dill and sawdust gets this wine off to an awkward start before it smooths out on the palate and shows good ripe plum flavors in addition to more toasted, oaky spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cline 2018 Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is firm and tannic in texture, spicy and oaky in flavor, offering aromas of sawn wood and sawdust and a grippy mouthfeel that dominates its subdued raspberry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Three 2017 Old Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a volcanic site high atop the Moon Mountain region above Sonoma Valley, this impressive knockout of a wine is thick and tightly wound in its youth, yet still imparts deeply etched components of sanguine currant, dried herb and earth. Balanced and powerful, it is structured and graceful, with a juicy core of blackberry and raspberry. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy best from 2027–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beekeeper Cellars 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A reserve-tier wine made only in worthy years, this delivers complex, richly layered flavors of blueberry, blackberry and nutmeg with plenty of power in the glass. Blended with a small amount of Petite Sirah, it comes from two sites in Rockpile, aged 15 months in French oak. Soft, rounded and in balance within its context of concentration, it offers firm tannin, dried herb earthiness and a lasting taste of black pepper and licorice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beekeeper Cellars 2017 Hidden Hillside Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a bold, tannic, structured wine that's also well filled out with potent blackberry and blueberry flavors for good balance on a big scale. Coming from a rugged, mountainous grape-growing district, It shows great concentration, depth and excellent aging potential. Best from 2023–2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2016 Rock's Edge Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fascinating briary, peppery aromas and flavors give this full-bodied wine extra personality, while a core of superconcentrated black fruits is wrapped in firm tannins. It's very tasty now and has the structure to age and improve. Best through 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2016 Lily Hill Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Effusively and powerfully built around blackberry and graham cracker flavors, this bold, structured mountain wine is soft and unctuous on the palate. Firm, integrated tannin and oak don't hinder but rather add to the intrigue and appeal, leading to a finish of cinnamon and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2017 Primitivo Clone Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a dry-farmed site planted at 1,500-foot-elevation, this wine shows power and concentration, blended with a small portion of Petite Sirah. Tight, firm tannin weight supports earthy sage, dried herb and mocha, a whiff of mountain air elusively emanating from the glass. Dark, brooding black fruit remains fresh and vibrant, framed in a stone-like minerality.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beekeeper Cellars 2017 Secret Stones Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hints of flint, earth and sage blend with luscious blueberry and blackberry flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic but also beautifully polished and drinkable wine. Best through 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2016 Barrel 32 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Ripe and rich but also complex and well delineated, this full-bodied wine boasts alluring baking-spice and black-fruit aromas, deep blackberry and black-cherry flavors, and a wonderful sense of polish, balance and completeness. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2016 Block 10 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-plum and berry aromas meet with smoked meats on the nose of this reserve Zinfandel. There is an impressive heft to the palate without showing too much ripeness, offering flavors of stewed blackberry and roasted beef.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2017 The Defector Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: From vines planted before Prohibition, this balanced, burly red is sinewy, with components of black pepper, gravel, stone and iron. Red- and black-cherry fruit is rich and layered, with lovely contrasts of leather, tannin and spicy oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart, tannic, youthful and powerful, this balanced red wine offers understated elegance and delicate texture, its fruit defined in sanguine currant and plum. Sleek and soft on the palate, it leads to an integrated finish of baking spice, toasted oak and leather.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Jewell 2017 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: From the estate grower of this ranch, this red is thick, rich and viscous in black cherry, cola, cinnamon and oak. Acidity and earthy mineral elements of stone and graphite underscore its complexity and ultimate elegance as well as mountain terroir.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2017 Beatty Ranch Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumed in bramble, this is a thick, viscous and fruity wine, brimming in dark cherry and berry with sanguine and savory elements. A sizable 13% Petite Sirah is blended in, providing additional body richness and power that finishes plush and lush.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Carol Shelton 2016 Rocky Reserve Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With an exuberant blackberry nose, this wine is lifted by accents of herbs and earth. Supple tannins support a weighty core of black licorice and currant flavors.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is packed with deep ripe yummy berry and black-cherry flavors and wrapped in an ultrasmooth texture. It carries all that flavor and weight very gracefully.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella 2016 Maple Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and deep yet not overly ripe black-fruit flavors show on the nose of this bottling, alongside a pinch of nutmeg powder. It snaps on the sip with fresh blueberry and more black-fruit flavors, with a touch of violet as well.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lone Madrone 2016 Bailey Ranch Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site planted in 1926, this wine blends in 10% Alicante Bouschet. Juicy, dusty, supple and complex, it has structure and a sturdy core of jammy plum, black licorice and black pepper, the tannins firm and supportive.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2017 Old Vine Montafi Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lime Kiln Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A great expression of the Gillian Enz Vineyard, located very close to the historic Enz Vineyard, this bottling shows aromas of blackberry jam, roasted black cherry and loamy soil on the nose. The palate is framed by bright acid and tight tannins, offering flavors of black cherry, violet and clove.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rexford 2017 Gillian Enz Vineyard Zinfandel (Lime Kiln Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Complex aromas and nice flavor concentration give this full-bodied wine an extra boost. Well-defined mint and floral aromas give way to black cherry and blackberry on the palate, firmed up by moderate tannins and good acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paul Dolan 2018 Made with Organic Grapes Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny in blackberry, cola and vanilla, this wine offers power and plenty of tannin weight and structure, the acidity bubbling beneath the surface and adding subtle brightness. Gravelly texture adds to the experience and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Loach 2017 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Olivet Bench Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the great high-elevation appellation, this wine is juicy, spicy and robust in tannin, with smatterings of dried herb and toasted oak. Blackberry, black cherry and black licorice combine and make for a memorably powerful, savory elegance with length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fogline Vineyards 2016 Rocky Ridge Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from vines planted pre-Prohibition, this wine is thick in tannin and jammy in high-toned red-berry fruit. Dust, cinnamon, nutmeg and oak play along the midpalate of weighted concentration and intensity, finishing with a trace of black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Loach 2017 Forgotten Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an historic, old-vine site, this bold red is full of dust, sweet oak and baked cherry and blackberry flavors, densely concentrated with smooth, rounded and rich character. Herbal components give it welcome complexity and contrast.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Loach 2017 Saitone Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is made from both estate and purchased grapes, including older plantings in the valley. Viscous and jammy with peppery, herbal components, it offers firm structure and bold ripeness. The oak is toasted and well integrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Frank Family 2017 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sinewy tannins wrap around powerfully dense red berries in this intensely concentrated wine from the mountain appellation. Dusty rock and earth give it a savory edge that matches well with the fruit, finishing in toasted oak and nuances of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2017 Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Baked plum and Christmas spices make for a rich, rounded and ultimately rewarding red wine, accented in dusty earth and white pepper. With lasting intensity, it broadens and brightens in the glass as it opens.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Loach 2018 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and tannic in cedar and oak, with a savory thread of tobacco and black pepper, this robust, full-bodied red is from old head-trained, dry-farmed vines. It presents a powerful picture of ripeness and lasting heat.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vite Vecchio 2016 Centanni Vineyard Estate Grown Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Aromatic oak spices lift the scent of this full-bodied wine before plush baking spices mingle on the palate with ripe plum and sweet cherry notes. It's nicely oaky in flavor and temptingly velvety in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sottomarino 2015 Primitivo (Lake County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tangy, textured and rounded on the palate in plummy flavors, this is an intensely flavored and robust wine that finds its balance in dried herb, cedar and black pepper components. From a high-elevation appellation, it shows dense tannin weight and structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Wattle Creek 2017 Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, peppery and robustly ripe wine, dripping in viscous layers of blackberry jam. Leathery on the palate, the tannins are firm and serious, providing structure to the richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sbragia 2017 Italo's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine presents tremendous value, made from the producer's own low-yielding, dry-farmed vineyards. Dusty black pepper, baking spice and leather give it a nice rusticity and character, with a touch of sandalwood and oak. Brambly blackberry rounds it out, supported by thick, firm tannins.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Buehler 2016 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This well-made red wine is fruity, softly textured and full in weight. Supple tannins lend balance between flavors of brambly blackberry, cherry, dried herb and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Buehler 2017 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Joyous aromas of dark boysenberry, strawberry and raspberry juice are ripe but quite pleasant on the nose, which also shows some baking spice. The palate is clean and bright, with a refreshingly juicy profile that blends plums with mace and clove.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castoro Cellars 2018 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With an inviting, vibrant nose of blackberry and cherry, this wine has a viscous texture and weight that emphasizes its overall richness and concentration. Vanilla oak closes things out, a proper finish that remains on theme.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kokomo 2017 Timber Crest Vineyards Primitivo (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: San Antonio Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This single-vineyard expression from southern Monterey County begins with a floral hit on the nose before diving into cherry-compote and crushed rock aromas. It's sharp on the palate with red-plum, hibiscus and cinnamon tones, finishing with a spicy kick of white pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lepe 2017 Wellong Vineyards Zinfandel (San Antonio Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hearty and full bodied, this ripe wine opens in aromas and flavors of leather saddle and cigar box. Dark chocolate, baked plum and cherry jam follow, the oak sweet and well integrated enough to allow for a velvety smooth texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fogline Vineyards 2016 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the region's Olivet Bench, this historic site provided a small amount of fruit this vintage, a mix of juicy plum and gamy bacon that is expansive and overwhelmingly dense on the palate. Toasted oak adds to the richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Loach 2017 Maffei Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Nicely focused fruit flavors and good balance make this medium-bodied wine both delicious and appetizing. Moderate acidity and a touch of tannin firm it up, carrying the fresh plum and cherry flavors well.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Precision Wine 2018 Prototype Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This dry-farmed bottling shows a wide range of aromas, from dark blackberry to fresh strawberry, nutmeg to turned earth and composting flowers. Tart red fruits show on the palate, which is powered by high acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lone Madrone 2016 Sheep Camp Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Vivid fruit flavors and good structure lift this full-bodied wine above the crowd. It offers tempting strawberry and raspberry aromas, then deeper blackberry flavors wrapped in moderate tannins for a good mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Federalist 2017 Bourbon Barrel Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This old vine bottling, which includes 15% Grenache and 10% Carignane from a vineyard planted in the 1940s, shows much promise. Foggy in the glass, it begins with aromas of blistered red plums, wild cherry, mulberry and condensed rosewater. The palate zings with tangy acidity, blending ripe red fruits with clove and mace.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kuchan 2017 Lepi Bregi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This brawny, intensely ripe wine is dripping in red licorice, blackberry jam and seamless tannin, packing plenty of heat on the palate. Concentrated and soft, it finishes in high-toned acidity and a lasting touch of vanilla oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Wattle Creek 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit shy at first on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of muddled black plum, cherry and dried oregano on the nose. The more aggressive palate is loaded with dark fruit that is doused in herbs and baking-spice flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Crooked Path 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Fresh, fruity and almost-sweet, this easy-to-drink wine blends light oak spices with rich plum and strawberry flavors, kicking in hints of wood smoke and pepper for complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Neyers 2018 Vista Notre Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated cherry, smoke, rose petals and tobacco leaf meet with a touch of tang on the nose of this bottling. Tart red-plum and brisk strawberry flavors meet with wild herbs on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Riverstar 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 5% Petite Sirah, this wine is then aged in both American and Hungarian oak. Flavors of raisin cake, baked cherry and sweet oak combine around a juicy, exuberant style that finishes jammy and full.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gehricke 2018 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a hearty, abundantly ripe wine, broadly thick and concentrated in syrupy black fruit. The oak is appropriately matched, adding weight and woody elements alongside hints of tobacco and brush.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sbragia 2017 Nonno's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with small percentages of Petite Sirah and Lagrein, this is a brawny, leathery red, textured and high toned in red berry. Dried herb, chalky tannin and robust ripeness give it a powerful weight and breadth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ballentine 2017 Estate Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Toasted marshmallow and oak are met by dense layers of thick, rich dark cherry and blackberry in this full-bodied wine. Softly structured, it appeals in its approachability and integration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Frei Brothers 2017 Sonoma Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Immensely powerful and ripe, this value-priced, large-production wine delivers plenty of juicy blackberry flavor around accents of cola and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kirkland Signature 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is broad in texture, ripe in flavor and rather light in terms of tannin and acidity, resulting in a soft mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Federalist 2017 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This hearty red tastes of barbecue meat and char. Rounded and rich, it has a juicy, broad appeal of brambly blackberry jam that contrasts against the meat.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Loach 2017 OFS Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry-sauce and cocoa-dust aromas meet with slightly sour herbs and fennel on the nose of this bottling. Ripe blackberry-sorbet flavors are dusted in more dank herbs on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Joullian 2015 Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this is juicy and fruity, with a soft, approachable simplicity and robust, rounded flavors of cherry and berry. It fades slightly on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Lost Chapters 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very ripe, dried fruit flavors and a smooth, broad texture make this wine big, but not at all rough. It has a soothing, full body supporting raisin and plum flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Langman Estate 2016 Edward's Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very extracted aromas of plum, prune, raisin and figs are almost port-like on the nose of this bottle. It's thick and pruney on the palate as well, with roasted, nutty flavors of pecan and caramel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Riverstar 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smooth in texture and very ripe tasting, this full-bodied wine brings strawberry and cherry-jam flavors and a soft, sweet mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Big Smooth 2017 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Black cherry, blackberry and black pepper combine forcefully around broad, dry tannins and over-the-top ripeness in this big-boned wine. A touch of dried herb appears on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Wine Guerrilla 2018 Paradise Lane Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High toned aromas of bittersweet chocolate, herb and cherry are followed by sweet seeming, dried out flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Siren Song 2016 Viaggio Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This huge but polished wine from the Sierra Foothills is concentrated and layered, as moderate tannins and good acidity lift powerful blackberry and black-currant flavors. The tannins are fine grained, adding a velvety touch to the mouthfeel, and propelling wonderful black fig and dark cherry through a long finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Karine 2017 Three Daughters Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and well-built wine shows the classic briary aromas followed by meaty berry-like flavors that are both fruity and savory in character. It's complex and distinctive, as hints of black pepper and dried herbs join long-lasting blackberry and raspberry notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2017 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Floral rose and lavender greet the nose of this wine, made from a site first planted in the 1890s. Petite Sirah is planted within the same old block. Leathery, meaty texture and grippy tannin give it a towering presence of power and intensity within layers of black fruit, cola and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2017 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the great mountain site, this red is hearty in aspects of game, black olive, blackberry and cherry. Soft, supple tannins provide a foundation of weight and breadth, with teases of dried herb and black licorice melding with lasting acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2017 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft and floral, this cooler climate red is juicy in red cherry and strawberry, with an approachability to its vivid, expressive fruit. Lingering in baking spice, its concentration is appealing and broadly generous, with understated power and undeniable likability.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2017 Valsecchi Vineyard Zinfandel (Carneros)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Vivid and nicely structured, this full-bodied wine pours out freshly crushed blackberry and cherry aromas backed by palate-coating blackberry and baking-spice flavors. It's generous and rich in style, and has a good nip of tannin in the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2017 Big John Vineyard Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Richness and ripeness show off great fruit flavors in this full-bodied but fresh and vibrant wine from an historic vineyard. Moderate tannins frame the exuberant raspberry and blackberry flavors nicely and blend with good acidity for very good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2017 Old Vine Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Opulent, concentrated and layered, this full-bodied and velvet-textured wine is packed with ripe fruit flavors and subtle oak accents, while maintaining good balance and drinkability. Intense black-cherry, blackberry and black-fig flavors swell on the palate and linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Harney Lane 2017 Scottsdale Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Fountaingrove District, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with Petite Sirah and Carignan, this hearty red is sanguine and structured, with bright acidity that lifts the dense meaty fruit. Plum, dark chocolate and bacon highlight the dense concentration of richness that is balanced in oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Carol Shelton 2016 Peaceland Vineyard Zinfandel (Fountaingrove District)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Vibrant, fruity and well balanced, this medium- to full-bodied wine is packed with red-cherry and raspberry flavors on a nicely firm texture of light tannins and fruit acidity. It seems to get better from sip to sip to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2017 Roland Rosario Vineyard Elev. 1147 Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe delicious berry flavors mingle with earthy, peppery notes in this full-bodied and complex wine. Moderate tannins beef up the texture for great balance and let a classic briary expression come through.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jeff Cohn 2017 Rinaldi Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the tremendously beautiful, old-vine site in the heart of the appellation, this hearty red is juicy in brooding black fruit and savory black pepper, leather and oak. Dense and supple, it entices the palate with ease, developing increasing complexity as it goes.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2017 Pagani Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine is good and rich while staying balanced. It offers ripe plum and blackberry aromas, abundant fruit flavors and subtle oak spices. It will be hard to beat when a bold, firm wine is called for.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 10% Alicante Bouchet, the sweet, dusty nose of this red is generously juicy, with supple dried fruit that highlights this estate wine—the vines first planted in 1904 (at what was once known as the Robert Rue Vineyard). Made in a full-bodied, generous style, it offers structure and lush layers of plum, dark cherry and a lasting twist of nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Croix 2017 Croix Estate Vineyard 1904 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This brawny, unabashedly ripe, supple wine is thick in baked plum, dark cherry and mocha, with a viscosity that expands on the palate. Baking spice and cola mingle and add to the opulent style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2017 Cortina Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a pretty, inviting wine that is aromatically effusive in gorgeous cherry, berry and raisin-rum cake. Juicy, expansive and likable, it has soft supple tannins that provide support without interruption, finishing in a savory complement of meat, nutmeg and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Morelli Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Caramelized berries meet with maple and fresh rose petals on the dynamic nose of this bottling. There is a compelling intensity on the palate, where candied boysenberry and floral violet tones stay dry and pleasant thanks to the structure and acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Oblivion 2017 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny in style, this ripe, densely packed wine shows old-vine personality in its mix of leather saddle, black pepper and cinnamon notes that permeate through the baked cherry and plum core. Powdered tannins lend texture and give it complexity and weight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Berry bramble, tar and oak mark a soft, supple and powerful palate of approachable intensity in this powerfully built wine from the winery's own historic site, first planted in 1937. Round supple tannins ride a lengthy palate building to a finish of wild vanilla and cola.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2017 Aldo's Vineyard Estate Grown Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Salt and pepper spiciness meets tempting blackberry and black-plum flavors in this full-bodied, rich and mouthfilling wine. It's well balanced for drinking now, as light tannins and good acidity give just a bit of grip in the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Artezin 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy berry, leather, baking spice and pepper ride along full-bodied power and soft tannin weight in this old-vine wine, dusty on the palate and richly ripe.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Michael Moon Old Vine Teldeschi Vineyard
Name: Timark 2017 Michael Moon Old Vine Teldeschi Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Concentrated and complex, this full-bodied wine overflows with ripe berries, black-pepper and beef aromas that continue in the generous flavors. A big broad mouthfeel, full body and mild tannins all add to an impression of richness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hierogram 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This well-made wine has cherry-berry fruitiness and a likably soft smooth texture, with a rounded approachability to its richness and moderate weight. Blended with 17% Petite Sirah, it has understated power and integrated oak, finishing in a swirl of vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Decoy 2017 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine boasts delicious fruit flavors, a dose of spicy oak, good balance and a wonderful sense of polish. Jammy raspberry and strawberry flavors meet hints of smoke, meat and herbs.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2016 The Heritage Collection Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This full-bodied red is densely concentrated in soy, leather and black pepper—savory elements that highlight and complement the rich red and black cherry. Firm, supple tannins help support the weight and intensity, getting along well with the toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2017 Home Ranch Estate Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked strawberry, smoke, turned earth and a touch of hibiscus make for an inviting entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate begins with a soft texture, opening toward spice, earth and snappy red-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Crū 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Structured tart red cherry and orange peel accent a robust grip of tannin and weighty power in this bold wine, made in small amounts from the mountain site. Black pepper, licorice and cola contribute spicy seasoning against the bigger notions of fruit and texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2016 Beatty Ranch Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Vibrantly fruity and fresh, this full-bodied, appetizing wine does not feel as big as the ripe alcohol level suggests. It is full of crisp, just-ripe raspberry and blackberry flavors that ride a lightly tannic, mouthgripping texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2017 Herbert Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This offering is blended with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Carignan and mixed reds. Juicy and generous in blackberry and vanilla, it is a broadly appealing style, utilizing both American and French oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2018 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big and bright fruit flavors fill up this full-bodied and well-balanced wine, giving it great freshness and appeal. Raspberry, red-cherry and black-cherry notes meld with mild oak spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2017 The Donner Party Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 10% Syrah and aged in a combination of European and American oak, this burly wine offers tones of campfire, herb and game. The palate shows a thick, concentrated core of blackberry seasoned with black pepper and cinnamon on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Acre 2017 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this wine begins with cranberry, dried herb and wild chaparral aromas. It's clean and light on the palate, with brisk red-fruit, rose-petal and earthy forest flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bold 2018 Rorick Heritage Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Great concentration, pure fruit flavors and a nice sense of focus make this full-bodied wine hard to ignore. Very ripe plums and raisins are accented by smoky, peppery impressions, and the texture is broad and rich.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Klinker Brick 2016 Old Ghost Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is good and dry, showing honest fruit flavors, moderate tannins and a sense of concentration. Blackberry and plum flavors expand on the palate, filling out the full frame.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Winery SF 2015 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: This inviting red is rich and spicy in vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg, with soft robustly ripe black fruit. The density and intensity is layered in dark chocolate and mocha, lingering in toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2017 Bobcat Zinfandel (Oakville)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine offers a big, firm structure and plenty of potent raspberry and blackberry flavors to fill it. Moderate tannins and full body support generous fruitiness and maintain good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Belledor 2017 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full body and a moderately tannic texture go well with the ripe black-cherry and blackberry flavors of this bold and appetizing wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Belledor 2017 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big concentrated wine offers delicious ripe fruit and spice flavors, plenty of new oak accents and smoky peppery nuances. It is soft in terms of acidity, and low in tannins, for a cushy texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cosentino 2018 Cigar Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has an entry of baked strawberry and brown sugar that presents as bold, rich and ripely sweet in this full-bodied wine. A dash of white pepper helps to even out the bolder aspects of big personality.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pezzi King 2016 Row 26 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Leather, hickory smoke, dried berry and herb show on the nose of this bottling. There are wild anise and baked berry flavors on the palate, which is soft in texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Akash 2017 Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Leathery and reduced, this big fruit-driven wine is thick and viscous on the palate, with strong powerful layers of fig, cherry and blackberry. The tannins are soft and well integrated and the finish dipped in dark chocolate and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: David Clinton 2016 Teldeschi Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A meaty, prosciutto-like aroma and firm, bitter cherry flavors make this light-bodied wine reminiscent of an Italian apéritif. It brings a nice Mediterranean mineral flair to the table.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Karine 2018 Three Daughters Rosé of Primitivo (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer reserved notes of wet clay, cherry candy, spice, dark coffee and dried herb. The palate is considerably more giving, with full-bodied flavors of vanilla, cherry and baking spice, with the oak—65% new European and American—getting a bit out front of the fruit at times.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Art Den Hoed Vineyard Painted Hills
Name: Maryhill 2016 Art Den Hoed Vineyard Painted Hills Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Deep ripe fruit flavors and an expansive, mouthfilling texture make this full-bodied wine an easy choice. It's rich and chocolaty.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paskett 2017 Cherryhouse Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied, rustic and flavorful wine that smells earthy and tastes ripe, almost raisiny. It has good structure, texture and balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brutocao 2016 Estate Bottled Contento Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ultrasmooth and mouthfilling, this full-bodied wine boasts ripe plummy jammy aromas and flavors, a rather soft mouthfeel and relaxed tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mineral Wines 2016 Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Plush aromas of strawberry jam and baking spices lead to almost-sweet fruit flavors and a maple accent on the palate. The texture is soft and generous, showing very little tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2017 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, herbal and spicy wine, blended with a small amount of Petite Sirah. Dense and richly packed in ripe plum, cherry and root beer, it offers viscosity and intensity, with hints of baking spice and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: V. Sattui 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lime Kiln Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sour black-plum, lanolin and herbal spice aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a rarely used appellation in San Benito County. The palate is full and thick, with baked mulberry, wild berry and gingerbread flavors proving very ripe and yet a touch sour.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wildeye 2017 Zinfandel (Lime Kiln Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very ripe, dried-fruit flavors of prune and raisin give this wine plenty of punch to go with its full body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2017 Old Vine Friedlander Block Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Black-olive tapenade, garrigue and sanguine red fruit highlight a sweet, fleshy and lush palate of powerful ripeness in this vineyard-designate wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gracianna 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Syrupy plum accents a full-bodied power of grip and oak in this robustly ripe estate wine, additionally layered in opulent cola and brown sugar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pezzi King 2016 Elevation 1040 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny blackberry-syrup, brown-sugar and root-beer flavors highlight the big generous mouthfeel of velvety approachability, made to appeal in a wide style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pezzi King 2017 The Jester Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers very fresh crushed berry aromas and plenty of straightforward grapey plummy flavors. It tastes unusually generous and vivid.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lapis Luna 2018 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine offers a broad texture and rich, almost sweet raspberry and maple flavors that fill the mouth. It feels soft but full bodied, and oozes a strawberry-jam note that lingers on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2017 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is thick and fruity, with a mix of blackberry, cherry and cola on the palate that veers ripely into prune and baked plum. A layering of black pepper rounds out the brawny full-bodied experience.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Valravn 2017 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With 14% Petite Sirah, this hearty red is smooth, simple and rounded in approach, with robust flavors of baked cherry and blackberry. Dashes of baking spice give it additional richness and contrast.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Napa Cellars 2016 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Deep fruity aromas of baked berries and damp mint make for a very extracted nose on this Bourbon-barrel-aged wine. It's quite sweet and treacly on the palate, where berry-candy and brown-sugar flavors lead to a caramel-sauce finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2018 Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, viscous and grippingly ripe wine, sweet in vanilla and berry flavor, with touches of charred oak and smoked meat.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Precision Wine 2018 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens in inviting aromas of currant, blackberry and orange—a fruitiness that veers flat on the midpalate, overtaken by oak. Blended with 7% Petite Sirah, the wine is overtly ripe and brawny in style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Murphy-Goode 2015 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Giving up a swampy, earthy aroma at first, this full-bodied wine settles in to saturated prune and raisin flavors and a big but soft texture braced by alcohol. Its not at all tannic or tangy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2015 The Immortal Zin Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a big wine, hot in aroma, full bodied in flavor and quite alcoholic. It offers aromas of wood smoke and Bourbon, and a flavor like sweet vermouth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Viaggio 2016 Wicked Finger Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Great focus and a sense of purity make this full-bodied wine stand out from the pack. It offers gorgeous blackberry and bramble aromas, a lively but concentrated palate packed with more berries and black currants. Fresh acidity and moderate tannins set it up as a fine palate-cleanser and will help it age. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bedrock Wine 2018 Schmiedt Road Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This opulent, full-bodied wine made from 64-year-old vines offers luxurious, ripe berry flavors that drench the palate, subtle oak spices for complexity and a seamless texture from the first sip to the long, lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2017 Pilgrim Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Black-plum extract, lavender, candied pomegranate and cinnamon-roll aromas make for a hedonistic entry to the nose of this bottling. Strong licorice and blackberry flavors are framed by oak on the rich, pleasing sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2016 Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is big but graceful, practically overflowing with tasty, ripe berry and cherry flavors, and revealing delicious baking-space accents as it opens in the glass. It feels smooth and luxurious in texture and has a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2017 Epicenter Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This concentrated and full-bodied wine blends herbal, earthy accents with appealing blackberry flavors, mild tannins and a sense of depth on the palate. It offers enticing complexity, great structure and a long finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starr 2016 Phil's Selection Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean blackberry sorbet, vanilla ice cream and crushed slate aromas make for a complex and inviting nose on this bottling. It's clean and expressive on the palate as well, offering dark strawberry, creamy vanilla and strong spice notes, with just enough tannin and acid to conclude the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broken Earth 2017 Vineyard Select Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boysenberry meets with potpourri on the nose of this bottling. There is a hearty core to the palate, where firm tannins hold up flavors of oak, dark berry and wet stone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light berry and strawberry-punch aromas make for a playful entry to the nose of this bottling. The sip has a surprising amount of structure and grip, upholding those fresh flavors of strawberry, baked pastry and vanilla.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seven Oxen 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This alluring wine offers beautifully ripe blackberry and black-plum flavors, with accents of baking spices and warm cedar for a layered and indulgent expression of the variety. A full body and a mouthfilling presence emphasize the delicious fruit and oak-spice elements.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael David 2016 Earthquake Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Although full bodied, this wine is light-hearted, jammy and fresh-tasting, offering ripe strawberry flavors on a good frame of moderate acidity and light tannins. It finds excellent balance between the effusive fruit character and a tangy, lip-smacking texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bedrock Wine 2018 Esola Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Delicious fruit flavors are clean and clear in this full-bodied wine, shaded by hints of black pepper and crushed rocks and wrapped in velvety tannins. It's very pure and fruity, and well balanced on a big scale.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cline 2017 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: It's hard to beat this medium- to full-bodied wine for lively, fresh fruitiness and zingy balance. Bright red-cherry, blackberry and raspberry notes fill the aroma and flavor, while good acidity and light tannins make for a nicely gripping texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Parducci 2017 Small Lot Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: The fruit flavors in this full-bodied and luxurious wine go very deep, offering blackberry and cherry-syrup impressions on the layered and velvety texture. Baking spices like cinnamon, vanilla and clove dress up the aroma and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2016 Two Bud Block Reserve Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is rich in fruit flavors but nicely balanced by good acidity and light tannins. It's full bodied, complex in flavor, showing ripe plum, blackberry and hints of spice and tobacco.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2017 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine nicely captures the lively side of the variety as it shows off vivid raspberry, blackberry and bramble aromas. Ripe but bright fruit flavors are accented by baking spices and black pepper on the palate, while firm acidity and mild tannins balance it all.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ivory and Burt 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a historic vineyard, this is Zin done in an old-school, lighter style. Aromas of red plum, wet stone, damp wood and red spice show on the nose. A lush strawberry-sorbet flavor underlies the palate, where wild mint and more soggy forest-floor touches also arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stephen Ross 2017 Dante Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This lower alcohol, Catalina Island bottling is reminiscent of old-style California Zin, offering rustic aromas of smoked meat, herbs and cedar on the nose. There is a pine-needle element to the sip, where wild berries offer a flash of fruit before eucalyptus pops on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rusack 2017 Santa Catalina Island Vineyards Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Tempting fruit flavors and an appetizing structure combine nicely in this full-bodied wine, making it taste and feel complete. Classic blackberry and black-pepper aromas give way to juicy, berrylike flavors wrapped in just-firm-enough tannins and acidity for a good grip on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bedrock Wine 2018 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried black cherry, cola, nutmeg and earthy black-plum aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The black-plum character flows into the palate, where purple-flower elements also arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Midnight 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hints of wood smoke and black pepper accent the deep, dark fruit flavors in this full-bodied and firmly textured wine. The concentrated berry core is framed by moderate tannins and a good touch of acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2017 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An attractive, sunbaked earthiness gives this full-bodied wine a distinctive edge as it pours out deep blackberry and grilled plum flavors that ride the mouthfilling texture. It's a warming, hearty wine with personality.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine smells and tastes extremely fresh as it pumps out strawberry, raspberry and sweet plum flavors on a slightly tangy, lightly tannic texture. It's easy to love the wine's exuberance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2018 Organic Grapes Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is superflavorful, almost sweet, and brings together bright, fresh and concentrated berry flavors and a good lip-smacking texture of firm tannins and good acidity. It has medium to full body, and a lightly grippy mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Zinsane 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine tastes juicy, meaty and full flavored, mingling ripe raspberry and blackberry with more earthy, savory overtones that give it an extra dimension. Full body and moderate tannins beef up the texture in a good way.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A handsome oak spiciness meets fresh berry flavors in this full-bodied, firm-textured wine. Vanilla, cinnamon and cardamom fill the aroma and last all the way through the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Graziano 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is solidly fruity, well-structured in terms of moderate acidity and tannins, and will pair well with rich proteins. It blends black-cherry and blackberry flavors with light hints of oak spice                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mud Pie 2017 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
